dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more tug on the sheet and we see, and suddenly hear, William Starks' P.O.V. the CHAOS of the hospital around h as DOCTORS and NURSES tend as best as they can to the inj soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our glimpse of STARKS reveals a red stretcher -- soaked i and the severe head wound where a bullet's minced his sku

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, slowly, steadily, a heartbeat is heard over the muf sounds of the hospital and, as his pulse quickens, so doe the pace of the world around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember there was so much white everywhere. And I felt peace...even though there was war around me. And I felt alive, even though I knew I was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, let's tag these guys and get them out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INTERN, clipboard in hand, stands above STARKS' unmovi body with another INTERN (2) beside him. INTERN 1 pulls the rest of the SHEET off of STARKS as the OTHER searches his DOG TAGS and gently closes his EYES with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERN #2 [Reading from the TAGS] Starks, William. Born December 25,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERN #1 Wait, so how old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERN #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERN #1 [Searching through records] Here he is. William Starks. Born in Vermont. He hasn't got a family listed. The naval hospital'll figure out what to do with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the INTERN puts the TAGS back down, she meets STARKS' open EYES -- now filled with surfacing tears, sadness, an She stares at them curiously and, after some seconds, STA blinks and a TEAR runs down his cheek -- jarring her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERN #2 [Calling out] Oh my God! This soldier is ALIVE! Code blue! CODE BLUE! This man just blinked! INTERN #1 He's been tagged already. Worry about the others... [then seeing STARKS blink] Oh shit! Shit! CODE BLUE! We need a doctor! Get a doctor over here now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the MEDICAL STAFF rush over to STARKS, preparing NEEDL and OXYGEN MASKS, STARKS merely closes his eyes and we fo the now BLOODIED white sheet as it falls to the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEWSANCHOR interviews CAPTAIN ROBERT MEDLEY (30s) -- a particularly photogenic and affable participant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN MEDLEY The level of arms on the ground really depends. [Answering a question] But no, I'd have to say we haven't had to engage on the ground as heavily as we might have expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEWSANCHOR Have you lost any men today, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN MEDLEY No. One of my Corporals took a bullet to the head, but it looks like he might make it. Looks that way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see only the HAND, and not the man to whom it belongs, enter the frame and pull the TRIGGER on a gun. The sound pierces the air, and the bullet hits the side of STARKS' in a FLASH, shaving the skin around it right off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS convalesces in a navy hospital bed -- his head hea BANDAGED and his arms suited with I.V.'s and dressings -- MAJOR, a LIEUTENANT and a DOCTOR stand above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' face -- now cleaned of the blood that masked it b is alert, and striking. Even with the bandages, he remain well-built and strong, like a shot straight to the head w have been the only way for an enemy to take him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR Sergeant Starks was very lucky. A little more to the right and it wouldn't have wanted to come out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR But he's never gonna be able to remember what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR It's hard to say. Sergeant Starks could have retrograde amnesia or... [lowering his voice] any form of psychological suppression. It's very common with traumas like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Cutting him off] Sergeant Starks is in the room, [beat] and I want to know when I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he speaks, STARKS maintains the sharp, steady gaze o man assured of himself, even if he is lost among his surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIEUTENANT Sergeant, you have no surviving family in the States. I'm sure you have friends or distant relatives, but unfortunately we have no record of them yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAJOR Captain Medley has recommended you for the Purple Heart, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS lets the tribute roll right off him. He spots the CIGARETTES in the Lieutenant's pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Can I have one of those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIEUTENANT Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIEUTENANT lights one for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTOR There is help for you, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIEUTENANT Of course there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their VOICES start to fade as STARKS smokes his cigarette blowing the SMOKE upwards and following it with his eyes. He's finished with these men and everything they stand fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [V.O.] I didn't know where my home was. I just knew I didn't want to be there anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS -- recovered now -- walks by himself along a long highway. He seems to be walking away from things even if can't remember what they are yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN PRICE (30s) -- a hippie who happens to be a mother - her daughter, JACKIE (8) tremble in the cold next to thei stalled car. JEAN sits next to the car, holding her knees her chest, more like a child than her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE runs her little gloved hand over her mom's ski-hat head as she cautiously watches STARKS approach them. He c an arresting figure against the empty landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Come on, mom. Don't fall asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You two ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Our car won't start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Looking at JEAN] What's your mom's name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Cautiously] Jean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS takes off his backpack and kneels down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Jean? Jean, can you hear me? I need you to try to wake up, Jean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN opens her eyes, stone red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Your mom take anything before this happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Yeah, but I don't know what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE decidedly sticks out her gloved hand. STARKS smile and briefly shakes it. STARKS rubs a hand over his chin a cheek as he thinks of what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Nice to meet you, Jackie. Why don't you wrap this scarf around yourself and try to keep your mom awake while I take a look at your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Starks works on their engine, JACKIE anxiously watches mother throw up in the distance. STARKS sees her watching tries to distract her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS What do you think of all this snow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE looks at him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Beat] Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at her and smiles at her honest answer; Jack turns her head back towards her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE But I like it I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Hey, can you reach the gas pedal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE gets behind the wheel, crouching down in the seat enough so her foot reaches the pedal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Go ahead, turn it on. Keep pushing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE revs up the engine and, a few coughs and sputters later, the car settles into a nice, working hum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Smiling] It works!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE steps down. She looks like she could hug Starks an unexpectedly, decides to. As STARKS awkwardly returns it, sees JEAN lifting her eyes to see him holding her daughte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN Get your fucking hands off my daughter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Mom, he just fixed our car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN Jackie, get in the car. NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN reaches for a RIFLE in the back of the truck but stumbles from the nausea before she can pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN Look, I don't want any trouble, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Neither do I, ma'am. I'll be on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Mom, you've got it wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS motions for JACKIE to stop as he collects his bags

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE You're just gonna walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yeah, I'll hitch a ride or something. [Beat] Let her throw it all up before she gets back behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' DOG TAGS are tied to the ZIPPER of one of his bag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE What're those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Dog tags. [Off her blank look] They've got your name and date of birth for identification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] In case you get lost, or can't remember who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS unties them and gives them to her. She reads them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I think I can remember what's on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE William Starks. [Beat] Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS faces the screen with nothing but a cryptic BLACKN about him and a confused look on his face as a MENACING V questions him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE (O.S.) "Jackie" and "Jean" are the only ...things you know for certain about that day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE (O.S.) Are you aware we have no last name, no place of residence, and no record of any physical presence for these "friends" of yours? How's that possible in this day and age?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods as a muffled "Objection" flickers away in the background...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE (O.S.) I may need to actually hear that answer, Mr. Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Starks' answer, the background of the courtroom is suddenly illuminated and we see that THIS IS STARKS' OWN TRIAL. The VOICE belongs to a satisfied PROSECUTION who t to face a medium-sized CROWD watching on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are three KEY WITNESSES called to the stand: CAPTAI MEDLEY, Starks' commanding officer in the Persian Gulf; D HALE, a psychiatrist; and OFFICER NASH, the cop who first came upon the crime scene. Their three testimonies are intercut to present the case against Starks quickly and confusingly -- just like it appears to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER NASH [Emotional] Eddie [correcting himself], Officer Harrison, was lying in a pool of his own blood -- on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. HALE William Starks could be blocking the incident. It would explain his well- systematized scheme about the little girl and her mother. A delusion as complex as that can often replace the reality of an incident like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER NASH [Cont'd] Officer Harrison'd been shot three times. He was long dead by the time we got there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. HALE I have heard of Gulf War Syndrome. The medical community is only beginning to gather information about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROSECUTION Gulf War   Syndrome? What the...Why don't we   start diagnosing Hard Life Syndrome   while we're at it? I've gotten a   lot of convictions we could overturn   with that logic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN MEDLEY Sergeant Starks was awarded the Purple Heart. That award doesn't applaud violence or murder. [Beat] It applauds honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. HALE [Cont'd] His subconscious is blocking it, the same way it began to in the Gulf, particularly as something similarly traumatizing happened to him then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following summations are punctuated by the BLACK FADE between them and the simulated BLACK around them as they speak -- like STARKS, at the beginning of his own testimo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROSECUTION [Disdainfully] It's not a question of whether or not he was sane when he did it?! He absolutely was. Three bullets in one man are three moral failings in another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN MEDLEY [Incensed] War isn't a CNN Special. Half the shit that went on couldn't be tidied into a top of the hour headline -- either 'cause it couldn't be said neatly or 'cause it couldn't be said at all. It was ugly. And they don't put ugly on TV. [Looking at Starks] If Starks did kill that officer ... [Beat] You can't hold a man responsible for a damaged mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEFENSE For God's sake, my client said he thinks he's already died once. He doesn't know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS lies bleeding -- eyes half open -- by OFFICER HARR dead, bloodied body as falling SNOW slowly whitens them b and covers any FOOTPRINTS that may have been left behind. hear a distant gavel delivering a distant judgment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [V.O., nearly whispered] I don't know how it happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' eyes finally close as he lapses into unconsciousn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JUDGE nods as he hands the JURY FOREMAN back the verd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JURY FOREMAN On the count of first degree murder, we find the defendant, William Starks, not guilty by reason of insanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his mind, STARKS is walking out of the woods as the su sets and bounces off the snow all around him. We see JACK watching him walk away into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDGE (O.S.) I hereby sentence you to be committed to a facility for the criminally insane, where I hope that doctors and the proper treatment can help you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JUDGE sentences STARKS, who stares back vacantly, lik man who checked out of his life long before this judge decided he had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white VAN pulls up to Alpine Grove Psychiatric Hospital bleak, dated facility embellished only by the barbed wire that seems to be everywhere around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' anatomy instantly and intensely separates him fro the staff of the hospital and the infirm patients who mig be in it. TWO MEMBERS of that STAFF lead him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDGE [O.S.] Mr. Starks, I hope that someday you might be well so that we will have lost only one life in this tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. THOMAS BECKER (overworked, dogmatic, disenchanted), D BETH LORENSON (30s, unassuming, perceptive), and DR. GRIE (20s, green) are convened with other STAFF at a routine hospital meeting. These doctors deal in the currency of madness every day and wear the heaviness of that burden o their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIEF OF STAFF I'd certainly say he should be considered violent, just given his case...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. BECKER How'd he dodge a conviction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIEF OF STAFF His defense argued post-traumatic stress and delusional disorder. He evidently couldn't account for a similar incident during his service in Desert Storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. BECKER [Beat] So why isn't he just in the psych ward of the county jail? CHIEF OF STAFF Apparently, he's a decorated vet. And had another one testify for him. Who knows? [To DR. BECKER] Tom, do you mind taking him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER shrugs a nod as the Chief moves on to the next ord of business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is shown to his room by NURSE HARDING -- stern, se and her henchman, DAMON -- a BURLY ORDERLY who relishes h command, however diluted it may be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON unceremoniously puts Starks' UNIFORM on the bed. He NURSE HARDING wait at the door for Starks to change into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON looks at STARKS -- his eyes inadvertently conceding Starks is more threatening than the common senile he marshals; STARKS stares him back -- deliberately concedin that he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS turns around -- only then looking stunned in the sterile, cotton-white room, wondering where his life disappeared to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS sits opposite DR. BECKER in a harsh, tiled office. STARKS wears his blue uniform and BECKER wears a doubtful expression. From STARKS' P.O.V.: the DRUGS they've alread started giving him BLUR his vision of Becker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER William? William, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods groggily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I've given you some drugs to help with your adjustment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Cutting him off] What kind of drugs? [Beat] 'Cause these seem pretty...pretty serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Well, your condition's pretty serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] So they say. [Off Becker's steady gaze] What? BECKER I'm just looking at you. Does that make you uncomfortable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Depends on what you're seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER eyes STARKS mistrustfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER You said you couldn't remember killing Officer Harrison. Correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] You don't believe me, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER It's not my job to believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Squinting to better see] You're a doctor. I would think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Cutting him off firmly] It's not my job to believe you or to understand you. It's my job to try to cure you and if that's a no-go, then to...take some kind of care of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Flatly] Lucky me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER looks at Starks -- his eyes casting shame upon the alleged murderer that sits before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Stupefied] You shot a man three times: first in his heart, then in his stomach and then...point blank, in the back of his head. And then you just...forgot all about it. A whole life erased with three easy little words: I. Don't. Know. What would it be if we could all not know what we didn't want to have to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER glances at his WATCH and gets up -- still blurred Starks' P.O.V. It's only as he's walking off that Starks notices he has a limp.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY, ALPINE GROVE, DAY
dialogues.text: From STARKS' P.O.V., we follow him walk down the hospital halls, even hazier from the medication than before. FORMS blur into one another and, on either side of him is a cra world with crazy patients who've lost their way in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS reaches for the WALL and runs his HAND over it, tr to keep his balance. He's walking towards BECKER who stan at the end of the hall, talking to other PATIENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Softly] I don't belong here. I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS falters but stays up. He turns to see a shell of a OLD MAN looking right through him with wooden eyes. STARK eyes stay so completely fixed on the old man's haunting s that he doesn't see what's ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bumps right into a HYSTERICAL PATIENT whose sudden, earsplitting SCREAMS peal interminably through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Mumbling] I'm sorry. I didn't mean... I'm sorry. I didn't mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' fumbled efforts to help the PATIENT only feed his hysteria more. The SCREAMING is intolerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Forced to yell] Will you listen to me? I'm not going to hurt you. Please. I didn't mean to bump...I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ORDERLIES and NURSES, followed by DR. BECKER, surround th now, violently pulling STARKS off the patient. BECKER, familiar with the PATIENT (HAROLD), tries to calm him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER It's ok, Harold. It's ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS searches their blurred faces and stops on Becker's they restrain him and give him more drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [To Becker] I don't belong here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Angrily, to the ORDERLIES] Get him to his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is slowly rebounding from the drugs when he hears disquieting FOOTSTEPS in the hall, coming closer and closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What follows happens too quickly for STARKS to react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES, NURSE HARDING AND DAMON -- enter Starks' room. They close the door and deftly administer a TRANQUILIZER a GAG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS has no idea what's happening to him as they drag h out, and his STIFLED CRIES ensure no one else does either

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE HARDING Come on, army boy. Time for some therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first face STARKS sees as the world comes into focus NURSE HARDING'S. Around it loom those of DR. BECKER, DR. GRIES and DAMON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot of the room shows a constraint-ridden apparatus hanging sternly on the wall. It is THE JACKET: an apparat designed to encase a man's body. Made of coarse, sickly- stained red ands brown canvas and velcro restraints that first chafe, then forever burn, the skin they're wrapped around, the JACKET looks medieval. Its appearance suggest its purpose: to slowly STRANGLE THE LIFE OUT OF A MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS has been stripped of his blue uniform and is lying nearly naked on a burial slab in the cold of the basement Even under the tranquilizers, STARKS formidably resists t as the ORDERLIES wrestle to strap him in. Then Starks, sensing as anyone would, that something bad is being done him, wisely stops resisting long enough to petition them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Wait. Wait a minute... Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER motions for them to stop with his hand. STARKS bli trying to bring the faces above him into focus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I, I don't belong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER looks into Starks' eyes. Sanity stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER No. I don't think you do either. [Beat] But neither of us can do anything about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER barely nods and STARKS is trussed in the JACKET wi METAL CLAMPS. BECKER writes some details down, presumably about Starks' treatment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CADAVER DRAWER -- just barely deep enough for a body or enough for the height of a nose -- is slid open and STARK already dreadfully sheathed in the JACKET, is crammed ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ORDERLIES slam the cadaver drawer into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is literally entombed alive. Silence. Stolen breat They bolt the drawer and the CLANG echoes through his bod The BLACKNESS and CLOSENESS of the space choke him as his heart beats the frantic rhythm of his struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see only the WHITES of a pair of petrified EYES on a m who's losing it -- hyperventilating, suffocating... for a intents and purposes, dying the worst kind of a death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Combing the walls for any sign of an explanation of what' happening to him, STARKS sees a single white DOT -- almos like a fleck of dust -- flitting between undecided SHAPES the blackness until, slowly, it grows bigger and bigger..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's now a PATTERN of WHITE DOTS that changes the more ST stares at it. Beneath it seems to be a smaller pattern wi formless shapes and figures that STARKS tries to discern before they change into something else. Only after STARKS blinks does he start to see the WHITE of the DOTS is SNOW from a picture that is slowly and terribly coming togethe the following glimpses, each hardly longer than the time between BLINKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) A little river of RED marring the snow around it, spilling from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2) OFFICER HARRISON'S mouth just seconds before his last breath. His eyes close and STARKS sees and hears a FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3) From the barrel of a GUN fired near him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOOD sprays STARKS' hands as he looks down at them and realizes he's in the scene and not just watching it. He l up from his hands and sees in similar flashes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) The snow beneath the BLOOD changing to DIRT as STARKS stares at it. This time, the little river of RED comes from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2) The BODIES of IRAQI villagers, all still except one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3) That of a IRAQI WOMAN. She unflinchingly lays her hand in the entrails of a CORPSE and smears its blood on her face just before she lies back down among the dead, content to be one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only SOUNDS during these dreadful images have been a trapped man's anxious BREATHS and the BEATS of a HEART pumping so fast it could be a drum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen goes BLACK and QUIVERS as STARKS clenches his shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, as the MUSCLE beneath his eyes starts to VIBRA something terrible and wet falls from the ceiling of the drawer. PING! Right on his eye. The drop of WATER is enou to send this man right over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' EYES roll back into his head and start to flutter shaking the SCREEN right along them until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS stands outside his body, looking at the wall of drawers he is in. He bends down to look more closely at a STAIN on the floor -- DRIED BLOOD -- and as he runs his H it and stands back up, he is back in the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMAGES RACE PAST HIM too fast for him to catch anything b fleeting clips of them. The IMAGES are his MEMORY and, no matter how badly he wants to slow them down, he can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS sees JACKIE, 8, sitting by a window in the diner. turns her head towards the ENTRANCE and, as she looks the so does Starks. That is when he first lays eyes on a woma WAITRESS -- worn but still lovely -- leaving the diner. H taken with her and, for the first time since he's been in Jacket, seems calm. Just then, however, the reverie is shattered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drawer is yanked open to reveal STARKS' still, drench face. BECKER, GRIES and the ORDERLIES stand above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Take him out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ORDERLIES unstrap the JACKET from his body. Blood fro his chafed skin drips onto the burial slab. STARKS' eyes remain closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER William. William, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear BECKER's voice as it sounds to STARKS...MUTED. STARKS' EYES open only enough for him to see the PEOPLE'S FACES morph chillingly into one another's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES [Less muffled] Pulse is 16, temp, just a hair under 90. 'Bout right for three hours of psychosis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE HARDING That's not enough, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER looks at STARKS' battered body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Wearily, indifferently] It's enough for now. Take him to the infirmary and let him recover there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS sits, totally disoriented, in the ward with the ot more vocally INSANE patients. He runs his hand uncertainl over the SCARS on his arm from the Jacket and looks aroun not knowing where his PARANOIA ends and REALITY begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OLD MAN from the previous day is moving slowly with t aid of his walker. He is far less threatening to STARKS today...just a senile man about to walk into a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Getting up to help him] Let's get you a destination other than this wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUDY MACKENZIE -- 40s, smart eyes, fidgety, with an innoc face -- watches STARKS help turn the OLD MAN around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE That's Kingsley. Old bastard hears us, I'm sure. He just doesn't want to bother answering so he makes us think he can't talk. I know. I tried it on my mother for two months once before she fished out my tongue. Literally. [Beat] You're the cop killer, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yeah, guess so. How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE TV. Helps numb [makes a "crazy gesture"] any active mind. [Sticking out a jittery hand] Rudy MacKenzie. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE (cont'd) Welcome to the village, William Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS doesn't offer his hand, just looks back at MacKenz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Looking away] I'm not really in the mood to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE That's too bad. I don't believe in disposable language either -- you know, the small talk, the little talk. Chit. Chat. Useless. The game's something else though. Think about it: What can we trade with each other in the air between us? This... [running his hand through the air] is our court. [Beat, so eager it's sad] I'm ready to throw the ball. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at MACKENZIE and sees that the constant flow words from his mouth only masks the tragic hesitation in eyes. A dead arm hangs limply by his side, like a weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Relenting] What are you in here for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE I tried to kill my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Don't you go to jail for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE I tried something like 30 times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is, as STARKS rightly figures, no suitable response that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE She's bigger than me, and she's stronger than me. And I never planned on doing it. It was always in the heat of the moment. I didn't beat her or anything. Hell, she beat me. But when we'd start fighting, I'd go for the knife. Then she kept threatening to have me put away, and [looking around] she finally did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he talks, MACKENZIE notes the SCARS on Starks' arms. D LORENSON observes STARKS and MACKENZIE talking and starts walking towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yeah, well 30 times probably would make you seem crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE Or just plain stupid. You'd think by the twentieth time, I'd have found an alternative method. Maybe a more effective one, if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON Morning, gentlemen. How are you doing today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE winks discreetly at STARKS before he replies. MACKENZIE It's a hard one for me, Dr. Lorenson. [Finally turns to face her, grimly] The world around me, it's shrinking. There's not even room for light to make its way in. [Beat] Da-da-bum! Da- da-bum! I feel like the horseman of doom is coming for me, Doc. Only today, he's not carrying flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON reprimands MacKenzie by turning to Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE What? It's better than fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON And you, Mr. Starks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Already on the defense] I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON Mr. MacKenzie, do you think I could talk to Mr. Starks privately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE Of course you can, Doc. William, it was an absolute pleasure. Thanks for playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just before he walks away, MACKENZIE turns around nervous and uncharacteristically looks STARKS right in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE Hey...when they talk you out to the woods tonight and invite the wolves, dance with them. [Beat] They don't eat you when there's music playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at MacKenzie briskly, wondering if his words were directed or just the meandering of a nut. But MacKen just nods his farewell and starts humming as he walks awa dead arm in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON So you're ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Still distracted] What? DR. LORENSON I asked you if you're ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Suspiciously] I don't know. You tell me, Doc. You think there's anything wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON I don't know. You're not my patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks away. Lorenson gives him a once over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON You look like you've lost some weight. Are you eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I am. One of the few things I remember doing is eating. So I guess I must be exercising it off in my dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at LORENSON, seeing if he'll respond. LORENS looks back curiously at STARKS' pointed stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You done with your small talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS walks away slowly and WEAKLY -- a fact that doesn' escape LORENSON's observation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS walks into the bathroom, keenly eyeing the thin sl of WINDOWS at the top of the wall. He walks closer to the when he suddenly hears some STRAINED BREATHING from insid one of the stalls. He checks the first stall, pushing it open. It swings both ways since it doesn't have a lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound continues. STARKS walks slowly past the second stall to the third and then... WHACK! The door swings all way towards STARKS. BRUTALLY. He falls backwards -- his h just barely missing a fatal confrontation with the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON, the ORDERLY, walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON I'm sorry, Starks. Must have not seen you coming there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS writhes in PAIN -- straining for his own breath no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON [Leaning down close to him] Were you worried about me? [Smiling] That's so sweet. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, DAMON walks out, leaving STARKS on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS sits in his room, listening to the silence of the night interrupted by first faint, then approaching, FOOTSTEPS. Closer and closer...then harmfully near until DAMON and HARDING enter his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pause -- awaiting a reaction. STARKS doesn't give th one. NURSE HARDING You gonna get the fuck up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS walks stoically down the cold corridors to his own torture -- flanked by HARDING and DAMON on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all in the room. STARKS seems pretty calm. Only i C.U. do we see his eyes register the JACKET...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I'm glad to see you're cooperating this time, Mr. Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at the WIDE, STURDY restraints on it. They w really hurt if you hit someone as hard as you could with them. They might even knock someone out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON and HARDING move to undress him, when STARKS makes move to do it himself. They look to DR. BECKER who NODS t it's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON begrudgingly lets go of Starks but not before he st on one of Starks' bare feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS doesn't flinch. He merely turns away from them and bends down to take off his pants. On his way up, he GRABS JACKET OFF ITS HOOK and, using it like a weapon, aims to smack it across Damon's face. DAMON deftly ducks and the JACKET hits BECKER instead. The force of the blow sends Becker down, and as he falls against the wall, DAMON and HARDING leap to restrain Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER   opens and closes his eyes, trying to get them in focus.   His right cheek is cut pretty bad. DR. GRIES hel BECKER   to his feet and picks his BROKEN GLASSES up off floor.   BECKER puts them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES Hold him while I get the tranquilizer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON Fuck the tranquilizer! I got a foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON KICKS Starks hard in the back, nearly sending him d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER No. That's not necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER looks down and sees his own BLOOD fall on the floo He looks up at STARKS who, even in his pain, looks shocke the force he just used.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Let him go. [More firmly] I said, let him go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as they let him go, STARKS lunges for BECKER -- pushing him up against the wall. STARKS stops, presumably about to harm Becker but unsure, even to himself, of what he's capable of doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER looks fearlessly into Starks' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [An inch away from his face] What, Starks? What are you going to do? End me just because I'm an inconvenience to you? [Beat] Just like you did with Officer Harrison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' face registers the meaning in Becker's words and look of self-doubt crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER The only thing your mind is missing is a conscience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS lets go of him and, as soon as he does, DAMON and HARDING restrain him. BECKER calmly wipes the BLOOD from face, looks at his hand, shakes his head and walks out. DR. GRIES Wait...Dr. Becker, how long do you want us to leave him in for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER doesn't answer. He doesn't even turn around. DR. G goes after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES Just strap him in for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And DAMON and HARDING start to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER turns around from the window and we see that his c is BANDAGED. He opens a drawer, takes out some SCOTCH and pours himself a SHOT. He swallows some pills with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After he drinks it, he looks up to see GRIES standing opposite him, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES You ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES [Beat] Listen, I hate to bother you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Then don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES But... what about Starks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER What about Starks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES Should we be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Should we be what? Trying to change him any way we can? [Beat] Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES But the Jacket? I mean...should we be leaving him in like that? BECKER [As if stunned by the question] Leaving him in? [Beat] The medication I'm given him is intended to adjust -- maybe even reset -- his violent proclivities. You know, peel away some of those layers of hate. The Jacket's merely a safe place for that to happen. The grounds and the halls -- where I can't monitor side effects I can't predict -- aren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES [Still doubtful] But, but...what about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Mocking Gries] But...but what about the gun? I mean, should he have been firing away like that? [Shaking his head at GRIES] You can't fuck up a life that's already been fucked up. [Turning away] There, there's the insurance you're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES I'm not looking for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER shakes his head, laughing inside at the world's stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Beat] It's Christmas Eve, Justin. Don't you have somewhere to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER doesn't wait for an answer, just turns back toward the window and takes another sip of his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE HARDING turns on the television as DAMON sits in on the lounge chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE HARDING Ah, man, look, It's A Wonderful Life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON You got any booze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDING takes out a FLASK from her BACKPACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE HARDING 'Course I do. [Smiling] And it is the season for giving so let's get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON smiles and rubs his hands together eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot of the WALL OF DRAWERS, with no one in the room, j someone in the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS finds himself in the physically wrenching place on more. But nothing happens for some seconds. He breathes anxiously, not knowing what to expect. His heart beats steadily: THUMP...THUMP, until, finally, with each beat, SMALL WHITE FLECK becomes two flecks...then, two dots...then, two circles...then, the WHITES of a pair of EYES with a terrific meanness in them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EYES blink, then disappear like they were never there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pace of STARKS' heart quickens, and the inexplicable madness surrounds him once more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUNDS of BOMBS RAGE around him but he's in the middl the murder scene, watching OFFICER HARRISON lie on the fl He turns to look over his shoulder and sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a PHOSPHORESCENT GREEN NIGHT-VISION CAMERA, we se FLESH, and RUIN littering the sand. Slowly the terrifying images shift to a naturalistic, real-time documentation of the action -- the ruin -- as it's occurr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As STARKS blinks, TEARS fall and he hears, over it all, a counseling voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE (O.S.) When they take you out to the woods tonight and invite the wolves, dance with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TERRIBLE SOUNDS become less terrible as they fade awa MACKENZIE (O.S.) They don't eat you when there's music playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene morphs slowly and the following IMAGES appear vaguely -- forming the walls of the TUNNEL around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) C.U. A WOMAN'S NECK and a small child's HAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3) C.U. A black and white PHOTOGRAPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4) EXT. CREEK: A shot of clear water, not too deep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6) EXT. DESERT, IRAQ: A sublime sunset...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS walks up uneasily to the wall and touches the IMAG They move like they're liquid and, when they settle, the whole wall is replaced with one large IMAGE of a BEAUTIFU WOMAN -- a waitress -- standing at the counter of a COFFE SHOP, moving a STRAND OF HAIR out of her face with her ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS blinks slowly -- struck by this dream of her. He r out and closes his PALM around her like he might catch ho of the moment with this simple gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole WALL OF IMAGES twinkles marvelously, as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITRESS (early 20s) -- tired, with kind eyes, soft s and a beautiful mouth that hasn't smiled in a long time - emerges from the diner. Even with no effort, she is remarkably pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From her UNIFORM, we know that her day was spent there. STARKS simply stares at this WOMAN who seems markedly rem from the world around her. The only fact she wears on her that she's tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots STARKS and can't help but do a double-take. Bot are momentarily taken with each other, though she tries t hide any indication that she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets in her old car and starts it. As it warms up, sh looks for STARKS in her REARVIEW MIRROR and sees he's sti there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to walk over to her when she jumps out of her c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITRESS treads angrily towards STARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at her. He doesn't know anymore than she doe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS You gonna answer me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS If you're deaf, read my lips...I don't need a psycho following me today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] I'm not deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and gets back in her car, slamming the door shu She starts to drive and STARKS stares after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few hundred yards, she SLAMS on the brakes and tu the car round, coming back. Then she jumps out of the car heads back in the diner, without looking over at STARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes out -- this time PURSE in hand -- and sighs at Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS [As if she owes him an explanation] I forgot my purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods slowly. The WAITRESS gets in her car and look again at STARKS in her REARVIEW MIRROR. He has hardly any winter gear on him -- no gloves, no hat, no coat -- just and a flannel. He looks lost among his surroundings, as m because he doesn't know where he is as because he doesn't look like he belongs there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reverses towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS In case you hadn't figured, it's Christmas Eve. You're never gonna get a cab here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks him over and then rests her hands on the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS All right. [Beat] You got somewhere you need to go, Mister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Let me ask you that again. This time, look around and consider your options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being cold and freezing are his options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS [Beat] You got somewhere you need to go, Mister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Nodding slowly] Yeah, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Great, get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS So, where do you want me to drop you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS rubs his hand over his chin and cheek as he thinks over. She watches him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS You don't have anywhere to stay? STARKS I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITRESS takes out a FLASK and a sizable SWIG from it she swallows it smoothly, like someone used to doing so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Well, where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm not sure. [Beat] I don't really know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Of course you don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Why "of course"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Because in my life, it wouldn't make sense for me to pick up some normal guy with a place where he's from and a place where he's going to. It'd be too simple. I probably wouldn't know how to handle a situation like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Well, you definitely didn't pick normal or simple this time either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over at him -- momentarily suspicious. He looks innocuously; there's something innately safe about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS At least you're honest. That's some kind of start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS sees her take another DRINK from the flask. She pu out a CIGARETTE, and STARKS lights it for her with some MATCHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS That's great. You're not sure where you're from or where you're going, but at least you've got manners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs, noticeably more relaxed now after the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Well, you got a coat or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Looking down at his clothes] No. Doesn't look like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Well, how'd you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] I was dropped off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Do you have a motel or something? Money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS feels his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Well, don't you somewhere? Stuff? Belongings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No. [Beat] Not around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She casts a long sideward glance at STARKS, taking him an her circumstances in for herself. He looks back gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS All right, we'll get to my place and call around, see where I can take you. [Beat] Just don't think of trying anything. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS (cont'd) I have the biggest defense for gun control living upstairs from me. She's armed and angry even when she's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is on the PHONE, calling various shelters.   Her apar has some pieces of mismatched furniture, along   with a s of lopsided CHRISTMAS LIGHTS strewn around the   WINDOWS room. They, more than anything else, light the   place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS [Pleading tone] I could have him there in 15 minutes. [Beat, disappointed] Hmm. Yeah, thanks. Merry Christmas to you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Great. That was our last option. What am I going to do with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Nothing. [Getting up] Thanks for bringing me this far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Where are you going? You'll freeze out there. You don't even have a coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'll manage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS No, you won't. You'll die of cold out there and then I'll have to feel guilty. And I've already got more guilt than I know what to do with. [Beat] Do you want something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No, I'm ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves to the KITCHEN to fix herself a drink and STAR stares after her. Suddenly, a SMASHING SOUND is heard as something falls in the kitchen. STARKS' whole BODY TENSES as he wonders whether he's being taken out of the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Shit! That was one of my good glasses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she presumably cleans it up, we stay on STARKS who slo gains hold of himself. She comes back, DRINK in hand and pushes the STRAND OF HAIR in her face back the same way s did when he saw her in the tunnel. Even through her weariness, she looks radiant under the Christmas lights. takes a long SIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS [Noticing he's shaken] Hey, you ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] Yeah, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS You know what? It's Christmas Eve. And you look clean -- I mean, you're normal-looking. [Resolutely, for her own benefit] It's Christmas Eve, and I have a couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sadly, no plans for the evening anyway. She looks bac her EYES even more tired from the liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm not gonna hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS [Softly] I know. [Clearing her throat] I'm gonna go take a bath. Make yourself at home. You know, fix yourself something to eat if you're hungry or anything. There's nothing to steal, but don't be a jerk and take something anyway. And don't snoop, ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Ok. [Beat] My name's William by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS [Shakes her head] No, no. Let's not do the name stuff, 'cause you see, I don't want to meet you. I may want to help you tonight, but I don't want to know you. Honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods as she walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS, still without a coat, collects some WOOD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks in her fridge. There's not much to work with just some JARS and plenty of VODKA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS has lit a FIRE and set out a feeble dinner for the when the WAITRESS comes out of the bedroom in sweats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS The best I could do with what was in your fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks and sees a SANDWICH on a BUN in one plate and a SANDWICH on two different colors of TOAST on the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she looks over at the fire; it's obvious from the wa she looks at it that it's been years, if ever, since someone's done something like this for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I only lit it because it was so cold in here. I'm sorry if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS No, it's fine. [Beat, swallow] Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and goes in the kitchen, calling out to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS You want a drink? STARKS Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she makes their DRINKS, a curious LOOK crosses her fac just for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've sat down to eat under the blinking CHRISTMAS LIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS This is pretty good. Considering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eat quietly for a second. STARKS looks at her, then at his food, still subtly stunned by it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS So you're a waitress, right? I mean...from the uniform you were wearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Yup. That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You like it? WAITRESS [Beat] I do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Have you always been a waitress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS [Remembering sadly] No. I used to be a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] Why'd you stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Shit happens, and your life changes. 'Bout the best explanation of a lot of things that happen. [Beat] So how come you don't know where you're coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I don't know, but I think part of it's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks around as he decides to be honest with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS That I don't really know what's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him until a small sympathetic smile appears her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Well, good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS [Beat] Real is overrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS smiles back uncertainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You don't think that's crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Maybe. [Beat] Maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up her glass somewhat sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Sometimes I don't know the difference myself. And, you know something? I think I like it better that way. [Finishes her drink] You want another one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the KITCHEN, and STARKS clears their PLATES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS goes in the KITCHEN as she comes out with their drinks. He hears her turn on the RADIO. She lands on an OLDIES station that's playing "Girl of North Country" by Dylan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS smiles a little, then realizes he remembers, and likes, the song. It's the first familiar thing for him in days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out slowly to the living room, where the WAITRES sits on the couch, drinking. STARKS moves closer to the radio, leaning into it, listening and forgetting, for a s while -- only as long as a piece of song -- everything el

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB DYLAN If you go when the snow flakes storm When the rivers freeze and summer ends. Please see she has a coat so warm To keep her from the howlin' winds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS listens close -- smiling a small, sad smile. Over HARMONICA, we pull back and see two very lonely people passing time together the way people sometimes need to be able to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS This is a great song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS You remember it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Nodding slowly] It's like I feel like...I know who I am. I just can't remember anything that made me this person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When STARKS looks at her then, he's so close to a meltdow that it takes him a moment to fight his way out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS But hey, who can forget those words? The man just wants simple and good things for his woman -- that she be warm and happy. How hard can that be to remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS May be easy to remember, but not easy to get. Being warm, maybe -- but, look, you don't even have a coat and I still have to chop wood to make a fire. [Beat] And, being happy...you tell me if that's simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHRISTMAS LIGHTS flash drowsily to their own tempo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS [re: the lights] Why don't I try to get them to stop blinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is visibly drained, after the day and the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS They told me I joined the army when I was seventeen. That's when my father died and, before that, it was apparently just me and him since I was born 'cause my mom split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS So you never knew your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I guess not. But, as of now, I never knew either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yeah. [Beat] How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Never knew my father. I grew up with my mother. Actually, I grew up around my mother. She was great though. I mean, the way she was with her friends... She was this woman who had so much life in her, she had to find ways to kill some of it just to be like the rest of us. [Beat] She died young. STARKS How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS She fucked herself up day after day and then, one day, she fell asleep with a burning cigarette. [Beat] I came home from work and she was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEARS still run after all these years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS Yeah, me too. [Softly] Every day for the last ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS That when you stopped being a nurse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is surprised that he gleaned the connection -- and th been listening so closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS [Exhausted] Yeah, that's when I stopped being a nurse. I never thought I could stop being one, I wanted it for so long, but... you just can't do it anymore when you lose someone like that. You can't take care of other people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes and finally passes out. STARKS watche her face, lit serenely by the FIRE and the Christmas ligh It bears her grief even in sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He covers her with a BLANKET then looks around and spots only PERSONAL EFFECTS in the room on her mantle. He walks towards them, tripping slightly on a CORD from the LIGHTS stumbles but regains his balance by reaching for the wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he pulls himself up, he spots what is only inches away from where his hand landed on the wall: HIS OWN DOG TAGS, given to Jackie, only a couple weeks ago, hanging from a single NAIL tacked into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, he stares at his NAME and BIRTH DATE scored on t metal. He looks back at the WAITRESS and then to the few PICTURES on the mantle: they are of JACKIE and her mother JEAN. STARKS runs his hand through his hair, trying to swallow the improbability, and inexplicability, of the situation. STARKS' EYES search the room for ANYTHING that could help figure out what's happening. On the console is an OLD PAP and some MAIL. Totally disoriented, STARKS nearly STUMBLE his way to the PILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The label on the first BILL reads "Jackie Price." On the second, the same. And the third...until at the bottom of pile, STARKS spots an OLD NEWSPAPER with the answer on it DATE: December 3, 2004.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is absolutely stunned. STARKS looks over at JACKIE and, just then, the HARSH SOU of the DRAWER being opened rings deafeningly in his ears the image of her starts to DISSOLVE at this worst moment. is being taken out of the JACKET...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's DR. GRIES, racked with guilt, who pulls Starks out..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winces at the sight of the BLOOD and SWEAT streaked ac Starks' face. DR. GRIES checks his pulse and cleans his f as best as he can with a WET TOWEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES William, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His VOICE echoes in the morgue, sounding to Starks, as it does to us, faint and distant. DR. GRIES drips some WATER Starks' mouth. As some of it trickles out, it runs into t JACKET, burning STARKS' chafed skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' EYES flutter and DR. GRIES pushes the drawer back afraid of what they've done to this man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS clenches his face and pleadingly closes his eyes. SECONDS OF TOTAL BLACKNESS and SILENCE and he's back in..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only now, he's kneeling beside her sleeping FACE, just looking at it. STARKS doesn't know what's going on but he serene, sleeping face steadies him. He can only call out name he thinks she might respond to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Jackie? Jackie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, she answers with a STIR in her sleep. JACKIE Hm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see, in STARKS' eyes, the unbelievable connection: she the same little girl he met only a few weeks ago in 1992.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Swallowing, softly] Jackie? [Beat] What year is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [In a drunken slumber] What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS What year is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Barely opening her eyes]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks around as JACKIE moves in her sleep, almost falling off the couch. STARKS picks her up and, in her sl she WRAPS her arms around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS tenderly lays her down on the bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS picks up his DOG TAGS from the console, looks arou spots the TELEVISION and fumbles a bit as he figures out to turn it on. STARKS sits down, throws back the rest of JACKIE'S DRINK and another shot and looks around nervousl unable to explain what's happening to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE sits in her sleep as she wakes up, clearly hung ov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As JACKIE closes the MEDICINE CABINET, she sees her hungo reflection in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her face under the WATER and lets it restore som color and life in her. As she comes up, that's when she remembers the night before and the voice she barely heard her sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [O.S., echoing distantly] Jackie? [Beat] What year is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SHOOTS UP from the sink, staring at her reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE spots STARKS asleep on the couch -- newspaper stre all around him and the TV still on. He's holding the TAGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kneels down close to his face and stares at him for awhile before STARKS is jarred. He defensively GRABS HER WRIST as his EYES BURST OPEN, startling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Desperately] Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS lets his GRIP loosen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] I'm William Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short look of SHOCK cross her face before she leaps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Get the hell out of my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE grabs the nearest object -- the IRON FORK from the FIREPLACE set -- and holds it, shaking, against STARKS. S stays calm; he hardly expected a different reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE What'd you do? Snoop all over the place? You had no right. You had no right to go through anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] I know it doesn't make sense. It doesn't even make sense to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE If you don't get out of my house right now, I'll call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Remembering] Your mom was passed out on the side of the road when I found you. Her name was Jean. [Beat] She was dizzy the whole time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Trembling] Why would you do something like this? I tried to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Jackie, I'm William Starks. I can prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE What? Now you're gonna show me some kind of driver's license?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No, I don't have anything to show you. I'm here from a mental hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Well, you belong in one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Solemnly] [Beat] You and your mom were in a truck and she kept a rifle in the back of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Stop it! Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE covers her ears and looks at him, pleading with he eyes. STARKS' eyes plead right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm sorry for upsetting you, [beat] but I'm not lying to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE You can't be William Starks. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE William Starks is dead... [Beat] I've been to his grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE His body was found New Year's Day, 19...1993. At Alpine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Finishing for her] Alpine Grove. That's the mental hospital. How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I looked it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he remembers -- understanding with a chill that what is saying could entirely be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I gave you my dog tags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE No, you didn't. They found William Starks' body dead in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS How'd he die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I don't know. But he did die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS falters under the news. JACKIE looks around, throu her now blurred eyes, like she might find some help in th apartment. She settles for the BOTTLE of VODKA on the tab lowers the iron fork and takes a long heavy drink, then laughs nervously as she looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I know what this is...I picked you up when I was drunk and you probably thought I'm just fucked up enough to fall for this. But the thing is I know what I'm doing when I drink. I just usually don't care. Right now, I do though. And I want you out. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS It's December 25th, 1993 today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE No, it's not. [Beat] It's December 25th, 2004.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Desperate] That can't be. That's...just, I mean... You're telling me I died in less than a week in the time I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I'm telling you I don't care what time you think you're in. You're not William Starks. [Beat] I don't believe in many things, but I believe in death. And it doesn't give back what it takes. So whoever you are...I did a nice thing, you've made me regret it enough already, so please, just leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'll leave. But look at me. Look at my face, Jackie. I'm not lying. I met you and your mother. I told you then that I'd lost my memory. [Beat] There was no one for miles around so I know you know there's no way I could have known that from a pair of dog tags you had lying around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at her tenderly before he turns to leave. JACKIE, a little calmer, looks at the door like he's stil the other side of it and calls out softly, and sadly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Happy Birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks around him and, we see, from bottom up, the exterior around Jackie's house melt away as STARKS sudden faces the massacred village in Iraq. Shocked at what's happening to his body, he looks up, petrified. His body i wound as tightly as a knot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, we're glimpsing the scene through PHOSPHORESCENT G NIGHT VISION intermittently negotiated with real-time ima

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opposite Starks stands a CRAZED IRAQI SOLDIER -- seething anger and pointing his gun at a LITTLE BOY, presumably belonging to the MAN not five feet away. Next to Starks i angry CAPTAIN MEDLEY, ordering STARKS to follow him. STAR is watching himself in the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEDLEY You walk on. They pick up their guns and fire at you, you stay. They pick up and fire at each other, and you walk on! STARKS He's got his gun pointed at a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEDLEY That is not our problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yeah, well, none of this is our fuckin' problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS turns and aims his gun at a CRAZED IRAQI SOLDIER threatening to shoot a child. We hear him YELLING in Arab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What STARKS doesn't see is another IRAQI SOLDIER (2) aimi his GUN at STARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEDLEY We are leaving this site right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS doesn't hear him; he's busy perfecting his aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [To the first Iraqi soldier] Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the force of the word, the SOLDIER lowers his gun and LITTLE BOY flees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS, who is now in the scene himself, lowers his gun slightly as he approaches the SOLDIER. Neither speaks the other's language but they're both saying everything with their eyes. Neither moves his off the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, though, we see the SECOND IRAQI SOLDIER get a clear aim at STARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his SHOT before anyone else does. STARKS goes do as the skin off the side of his head is shaved off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He falls to the ground. As the rest of the picture fades black, all that is left is previously mysterious, still haunting PAIR of EYES that we now see belonged to the CRAZED IRAQI SOLDIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And over it all is the now more distant CLANK OF METAL as drawer is opened and the nightmare momentarily ended...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES, DR. BECKER, DAMON and NURSE HARDING enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER You left him in all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE HARDING Shit, he's probably dead.
