dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES [Defensively] I tried to ask you if we should leave him in yesterday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Don't get all worked up, Justin. I expected some common sense on your part and clearly I was expecting too much. [Beat] Just open the drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES We never should have done this to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Well, what are we gonna do about it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing is Gries' answer. Still, Becker seems to share th concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER motions for them to open the drawer. They pull him out. STARKS looks cold and wrecked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES Is he? [Impatiently] Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER feels for a pulse and seems surprised to find one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER No. [To Harding and Damon] Get him upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON walks into the ward to check on STARKS. The attending NURSE is walking around the ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Where's William Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE I'm not sure. Dr. Becker had him moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON walks anxiously down the halls of the hospit peering into every room, looking for Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON spots BECKER walking out the DOORS of the hospital and RUNS after him, in only his white coat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Calling out after him] Dr. Becker! Dr. Becker!...Tom, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. BECKER stops walking and waits a moment, registering voice, before he turns around to face Dr. Lorenson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Out of breath] Where's William Starks? BECKER He's recovering on the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Are you kidding me? He's not psychotic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Then how would you describe him, Beth? Merely rebellious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON He'll be a zombie in a few days, Tom. His behavior's hardly suggested he needed neuroleptics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER And you know that from what, a couple two-minute stares across a room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Firmly] He didn't need anti-psychotics, if that's even all you're giving him...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER ignores Lorenson's insinuation and merely turns hi CHEEK all the way round towards Lorenson so he can see th BANDAGE from the CUT Starks gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Steadily] After he slashed me with a hospital instrument, I determined, in my professional opinion, that Mr. Starks, needed a little placating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Beat] You sure he wasn't provoked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER You sure you want to begin making that kind of insinuation? [Beat] I took five stitches during a routine therapy session.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I'm sure he took some, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Smirking, unphased] Happens sometimes when you've got to restrain them. You watch the rest of us work. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Appealing to him] Our patients are sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Yes, they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON looks at BECKER; he knows he's hiding something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON He's not gonna end up like Casey, Tom. Whatever happened to him is not going to "happen" to Starks. I don't know what you're trying to do here ...but he's not a lab animal, Tom. You can't reprogram him no matter the drugs or the treatment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Jesus, you really don't let up, do you? Just because you failed your patient doesn't necessarily mean the rest of us did, too. [Beat] Sorry to tarnish your war hero's image, but he is psychotic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON looks back, starting to grasp Becker's misshapen beliefs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Now, if you'll excuse me, it's Christmas, and I have a family I'd like to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS, IV in arm, lies asleep in bed, recovering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE walks in a hospital -- with many aspects parallel the mental hospital. White on white and, for Jackie particularly, the presence of painful memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON walks closer to STARKS and carefully examines th BRUISES and BURNS on a body that's been badly beaten. His eyes bear his guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE waits until a nurse, CLAIRE, greets her perfunctor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE [Not looking up] How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Hi, Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE looks up, astonished to see her. She smiles warmly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE Jackie, hi. How are you, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I'm ok. [Beat] I need a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is asleep when a DARK FIGURE walks, like a GHOST, the WINDOWED DOOR of his room. STARKS opens his eyes and snaps his neck in its direction -- fearful of everything this point. When he looks, there's nothing there; he's no sure there ever was. The room starts to blue as he looks around it, not knowing if he is crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE peruses HEADLINES and ABSTRACTS pulled up on the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "ALPINE GROVE INVESTIGATION into the mysterious death of William Starks..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The body of WILLIAM STARKS, the former war hero who was charged with the murder of OFFICER EDWARD HARRISON, was found on the grounds of ALPINE GROVE on January 1, 1993. STARKS was believed to have died from a wound to the head."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words and PHRASES that confirm Starks' story RISE fro their couched places on the computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Local Doctor charged with medical malpractice." "Dr. Thomas Becker resigns..." "It involved the recreation of a womb-like environment." "Former patients testify to being put in instrument known as the 'Jacket'"... "Patient Rudy MacKenzie testifies..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "WILLIAM STARKS, laurelled war hero..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As JACKIE keeps scrolling, her face wears her disbelief t what STARKS was saying may have been true. Then, she sees archived in a state newspaper, a mention of Dr. Lorenson a particular patient, "Eugene Yazdi."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Local Boy, Eugene Yazdi, Overcomes Absence Seizure Syndrome to Win Mathematic Decathlon...with the aid of Local Doctor, Dr. Loel Lorenson." "Panelists for National Epilepsy Conference include Dr. Lorenson, Alpine Grove Hospital."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE is checking on STARKS as he slowly wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS What the hell kind of drugs are you people giving me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is asking the NURSE, but it's BECKER's voice that answers though Starks can't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [O.S.] Just something to help you sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS panics when he hears the voice. He looks around nervously but the BRIGHT SUNLIGHT pouring into the room i blinding. He swallows as he looks at the NURSE'S FACE as continues adjusting his pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Swallowing nervously] Did you say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NURSE shakes her head lightly and just then BECKER st out of the LIGHT. BECKER I said the drugs were to help you sleep. [Beat] Did you sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becker is remarkably calm, further confusing Starks' sens reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Doubtfully] But I wasn't asleep. Was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Yes. You were. You were asleep for nearly a whole day. It's December 26th, William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS sits up groggily, remembering what happened to him wondering how much, if any of it, was real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS It's December 26th?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS examines himself -- looking at his arms, spotting BRUISES on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER That's right, William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Slowly figuring it out]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER nods. STARKS sits up -- his predicament and the ro slowly coming into focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Yes. [Caustically] And that's the sun and you're on earth. [Beat] And I know you know better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS begins to piece if together. BECKER, as we begin t see, is right. It is 1992 in Alpine Grove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I don't know better. All I know is that you left me in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER In where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Uncertainly] In that thing...the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NURSE gives Becker a knowing look -- suggesting Stark really is delusional. Becker doesn't even flinch as STARK tries to get a better look at Becker's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER We were forced to use restrains if that's what you're referring to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS That wasn't a fucking restraint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Actually, that's exactly what our equipment is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' EYES widen with alarm as BECKER reaches for the I in his arm, lingering on it long enough that Starks brace himself for an ATTACK of some sort. But Becker just looks back innocently as he adjusts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Don't act like I don't know what's real. [Beat] I'm not the one that's crazy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Pointedly] Of course you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he clarifies, wryly enough for Starks to catch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER You're just suffering from delusions that are unfortunately part of your condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Don't give me that. I know what's real, goddamnit! You strapped me in something and stuck me in a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER nods diagnostically. The NURSE's nonchalance about as she LEAVES the room further disquiets STARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I didn't dream it. I may have been asleep but it wasn't a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER sits down in a CHAIR, half-shrouded in the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I had a patient a few years ago. His name was Ted Casey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I don't give a shit about your patient!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I wasn't pausing to see if you did. [Beat] But, incidentally, you should, because you're birds of a feather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS squints as he searches out Becker's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Ted raped and sodomized a seven-year old girl. [Beat] His lawyers asked me to have a look at him because, after his deeds were done... he climbed into the trees of the forest where he killed her and woofed like a dog. He couldn't even remember his name when I spoke to him, but, curiously enough, he could speak back. [Beat] Ted never went to prison because everyone -- including me -- was convinced he was sick. So he came here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER leans into Starks' view to make sure he's listenin STARKS is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Then one day a little girl came with her mother to visit a relative and I caught Ted stealing looks at her -- the kind you really have to steal if you know what I mean. [Beat] I asked Ted then if he could remember what the little girl who he had... slain ...was wearing. [Beat] He gave me a look I'll never forget, and, when he answered, it wasn't with a color or any sort of physical description I'd expect. "Oh yes," he said. "I remember it. I remember it well." [Beat] Those were actually his last words I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER's expression bears a hunting mixture of anger and remorse as he recounts Ted's tale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS We are not birds of a feather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Maybe not. [Beat] But I do think you're in a tree... woofing like a dog. And I'm just trying to help you the only way I can think of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER gets up and, as he moves out of the light, STARKS his BANDAGED CHEEK, reinforcing his memory of what happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Provokingly] What happened to your cheek, Dr. Becker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I was careless. Happens sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks out on the SNOW-COVERED GROUNDS from his roo the third floor. He seems pacified for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything about the dingy hospital punctuates the sad mechanics of managing madness. CATATONIC PATIENTS and dat equipment litter the hall and, as we follow a NURSE who w among them, we spot STARKS -- ARMS suspended in air and G EYES fixed on the ceiling -- pretending to be one of them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ARMS fall and he wipes his dried MOUTH as soon as she passes. STARKS has successfully made it out of his room. turns one corner as STARKS hustles to turn another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is almost   there. As RANDOM ORDERLIES pass him, S lets his posture   collapse as he despondently hangs his down so low they   can't see his face. They pass, and STA starts scuttling   towards the door to the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as he reaches it and is outside in the cold -- wi only his BLUE PATIENT UNIFORM -- Starks walks normally, l he no longer remembers the risks. Instead he remembers wh Jackie told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [O.S.] They found William Starks' body dead in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [O.S.] How'd he die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [O.S.] I don't know. But he did die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS leans down -- seemingly oblivious to the cold -- a lifts some snow to his mouth, TASTING it like a man who n to affirm he is still alive. He's so rapt that LORENSON's VOICE takes him by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Hey. You're not supposed to be out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS stiffens as he realizes he could be in the place w his body was found. The terrible question asks itself on face: Is this when Starks is killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Turning around sharply] What are you going to do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As LORENSON reaches into his POCKET for something, STARKS anxiously holds his breath. It's BLACK when it comes out a SKI HAT when it opens up. STARKS lets out his breath, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Nonchalantly] I thought I'd just ask you to come back inside with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS And if I didn't want to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I guess I'd ask you why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Because I don't think I'm crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You're not crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is surprised by Lorenson's agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You suffer from delusional disorder. That doesn't mean you're... crazy. It just means you're confused. And you're here, instead of in jail, because that was determined to have played a role in your killing of a police officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Correcting him] Alleged killing of a police officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You were convicted of the crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS That conviction doesn't convince me of anything. Until I know that I did it, I'm not going to accept that I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You may never remember at all. [Beat] Your mind's grasp of reality and the real events that have happened to you has been damaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No. The real events that have happened to me have been fucked up. Not my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON seems to realize -- at least for an instant -- t is looking at a desperate man who is persuasively, and cogently, staring back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Beat] William, I'd like to ask you something if I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Since when do people around here have to ask permission to do anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Suspiciously] How's your treatment progressing with Dr. Becker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS still doesn't know how much Lorenson knows, and if should trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Fine. [Beat] Why made you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON answers first with his eyes looking over Starks' body. STARKS merely stares back tersely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Carefully] I just hope you'd let me know if that wasn't the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Why, what would you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I could try to...make it stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No. I don't want it to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON So it's helping? STARKS [Choosing his words carefully] [Beat] It's making me feel like a different person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON -- sensing she's not going to get any more from Starks -- turns around to go back inside. It's only as sh turns her face away from STARKS that we see how nervous s is. But you'd never guess it from her tone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Casually] You comin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks towards the FENCES locking him in from every direction. LORENSON waits until she hears STARKS' FOOTSTE following her. She waits until STARKS has reached her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You should be careful. You could be killed if they found you out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Believe me, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and MACKENZIE are eating opposite each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS What were you talking about the other day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE I wasn't talking about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yeah, you were. What you said about them taking me out to the woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE clams up slightly at the mention of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS What do you know about the Jacket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE's eyes start to twitch nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE I know you need one when it's really cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Cutting in] MacKenzie, listen to me. Listen. I'm going to die. MACKENZIE Mortality's actually a great thing to be familiar with. It means you're sane on some level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Gravely] No, I mean in four days, I'm supposed to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE [Beat] How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS The Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE grows visibly more nervous at this second menti of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE Oh no, you're pretty young. Your body'll be able to handle a lot more of it than you think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No. [Beat] I mean I found out while I was in it that my body's gonna be found in four days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, NURSE HARDING is upon them. She carries a ROD her hand which she TAPS menacingly on the floor as she wa towards them. HARDING What are you two yappin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS tenses up as he sees only the ROD, which could inf a GASH if hit across a man's head the right way. Nearly e object could be a threat to his life as this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE [Spoken like a nut] [Beat] We're talking about our ability to go forward in time, to go into the future. [To Starks] That is what we're talking about here, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is startled MacKenzie gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yeah, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDING You know something? You're two fucking freaks is what you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Smiling] Well, no shit, Einstein. What do you think we're doing in this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE tries not to laugh but a CHUCKLE slips out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDING I want the two of you to shut the fuck up and eat your food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDING walks away with a final stare that Starks returns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Under his breath] I gotta get back in it, MacKenzie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE It's gonna be sticky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE's body betrays his discomfort talking about it its sudden jerks accompanying every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE 'Cause Lorenson's got her claws in it now. When she started getting suspicious about me was when they stopped using it on me. Women!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS So what am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE You could still always give Becker an itch. 'Course you might get killed when he goes to scratch it, but seems to me you're saying that's about to happen anyway. [Beat] Just be careful not to walk yourself right into something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. LORENSON and DR. GRIES are walking briskly to a meeti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES We're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I wish they'd skip the formality of this annual review and just cut our budget. Our silence on the matter should be enough to appease the civic conscience without wasting an hour we don't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES Maybe it's not such a waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON looks at GRIES askance before she sets the recor straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON It's the ticking of a box on a sheet of paper no one cares about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES They don't care about all the things we do right. [Beat] But they might ...they might care about what we're doing wrong. [Beat] That's what they should come here to look for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON can see GRIES is trying to tell her something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON What should they be looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES They should just be looking harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON grabs GRIES' arm, sensing the import of her word LORENSON Where? [Beat] It's Becker isn't it? He's doing stuff, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRIES Later. I'll tell you about it later. We got a session to catch now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is in a different ward with PATIENTS who appear mo threatening and disturbed. As he is anxiously looking aro presumably for a way out -- Starks hears one of the PATIE humming an eerily DISCORDANT MELODY. Looking to see who i comes from, STARKS happens to spot ONE PATIENT -- a young fierce-looking guy -- eyeing a YOUNG NURSE, SALLY, administering medication from a dated CART.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks around the room and notes there are NO DOCTO or ORDERLIES around. The YOUNG NURSE, meanwhile, is focus on the medicine -- oblivious to the BRUTE eyeing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRUTE's not that far away when he starts walking towa the YOUNG NURSE. STARKS starts in their direction, pickin speed -- maneuvering through VARIOUS INCOHERENT PATIENTS the BRUTE reaches the NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws her TRAY down and pushes her against the WALL. starts screaming as he pushes up against her. STARKS pick the TRAY and strikes the BRUTE across the head with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRUTE holds his head in pain as he tries to regain hi balance. It's clear he's impaired. But it's also clear he understands pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [To Sally] You ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she NODS, her EYES dart above to the HAND about to str him. Off her look, he ducks and turns around, punching th BRUTE in the stomach -- HARD -- but not before the piece he held from one of the broken MEDICINE BOTTLES comes perilously close to STARKS' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRUTE bowls over and STARKS looks at the GLASS terrif Is this when he dies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRUTE -- incensed more than ever -- lunges at him a f STARKS gets him by the NECK, expertly applying PRESSURE POINTS and, after only a few seconds, subdues him. STARKS himself seems surprised that he knew how to use them. He out a suspended BREATH, instinctively touching his FOREHE to make sure he's not cut. He looks back at SALLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLY Are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yeah, Why are you in this ward alone? Where is everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLY [Defensively] There's a state rep visiting so they've moved everyone around. But I've been alone before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Where are the other orderlies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLY In the therapy session downstairs. That's what the rep's sitting in on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Ok, listen. I want you to get out of here and lock the door behind you. I'll go get some doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLY looks at STARKS, wondering whether she can trust hi Her eyes shift to the BRUTE on the floor and she remember that she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STATE REP -- 40s, disgruntled, even drowsy -- is recognizable among a group that includes the CHIEF OF STA (Dr. Williams), BECKER, LORENSON and GRIES. They are presiding over a GROUP THERAPY SESSION when STARKS enters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Calling out] Sorry I'm late, Dr. Becker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER is noticeably taken aback but tempers his response

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Mr. Starks, this session is for our civil patients. Damon, please take Mr. Starks back to his ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS cuts him off and threatens with his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Derisively] No. Please, Dr. Becker. You can strap me in a Jacket or even gag me, but please don't leave me out of therapy. This is where I feel like I make the most progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER relents, seeing STARKS has the upper hand -- an AUDIENCE, deranged but eager no less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Fine, Mr. Starks. You can pull up a chair for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As STARKS walks across the room, it's obvious to everyone they turn their heads to watch him -- that he is a physic ailing man. Using all his strength, he walks up slowly to group, dragging a CHAIR behind him because he doesn't hav the strength to lift it. STARKS sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Mr. Jensen, please continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN -- a twitchy schizophrenic -- surveys the group seriously, determining whether it's safe to say what he's about to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN Well, [beat] I've been approached by the Federal Trade Organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER's not listening to a word JENSEN says. But STARKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Calm as ever] And what have they approached you about, Mr. Jensen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN They want me to head the Organization for the Organized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other PATIENTS look at him in wonder as the STATE REP listens limply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER The Organization...for the Organized?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN That's right. Have you heard of them? BECKER No, Mr. Jensen. I have not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GROUP PATIENT 2 That's because there is no such Organization, you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN That is categorically not true. Bl-bl- blatantly and manifestly NOT TRUE. I've been asked to lead them. But, if you'd heard of them, then they wouldn't be hush-hush, would they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Wearily] What do the rest of you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GROUP stares at one another silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Loud and emphatic] Well, [beat] I know they exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER And how is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at JENSEN, who looks back avidly. MACKENZIE Starks nervously, like he senses what he is about to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS When I was in the Gulf, the Organization was recruiting the Organized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Incensed] Is that a fact, Mr. Starks? Because if it's not, it doesn't help Mr. Jensen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Looking right at Jensen] It is a fact. Bona fide, and classified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON and MACKENZIE watch STARKS curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN I knew it! I knew it! Those little fuckers are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS They recruit only the best, Mr. Jensen. [Beat] I didn't want to have to say this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even the DOCTORS dare disrupt the silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS But these people [pointing to the Doctors] know about it. In fact, when Presidents of this country and heads of state leave office, they come here, to Alpine Grove. They're among us right now! [Looking right at Becker] Isn't that right, Dr. Thatcher? And Jensen, I'm proud they picked you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENSEN looks on nobly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS They're always ordering us to stay calm, but how can we be calm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS suddenly turns right at Becker, wrapping his messa to him in the seemingly crazed theatrics of a nut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Looking suddenly directly at Becker] All they do is give orders. That's all they have to do. And no one will ever know. All it comes down to is an order. [Beat] They've got hands everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS stands up, ready to SALUTE Mr. Jensen. The OBSERVE look to BECKER for order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Long live the Organization for the Organized!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Sit down, Mr. Starks! Sit down, Mr. Starks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, at that, Jensen's completely lost it. His excitement erupts in the form of him JUMPING out of his chair and eagerly and elatedly HITTING HIMSELF in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Sit down, Mr. Jensen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. OTHER PATIENTS are on their feet, HANDS jubilan up in the air. And, in the midst of the havoc, the speech order is soundly delivered in Becker's NOD to Damon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDOM PATIENTS Dr. Thatcher! Dr. Becker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON and HARDING grab STARKS while the other members of STAFF slowly calm the other patients. LORENSON is too bus notice them taking Starks out. STARKS winks at MACKENZIE, smiles somewhat sadly back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARDING and DAMON stand above Starks, who lies on the bru slab, already hemmed in the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON Starks, you're like a mule. You're real stubborn. But there's ways of fixin' that. All you need is a good stick. [Beat] Here's your stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON slams him in the drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' eyes dart about him; it sounds like something is there with him. The sound stops momentarily and, then, ou nowhere, a DROP falls on his eye. PING! STARKS winces. He clenches his face, not knowing when the next drop will fa His heart starts to beat more and more madly, punctuated the DRIPS -- making a score fit only for hell. He closes eyes and begins to die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and TENNY -- 30s, shifty, a total stranger -- sit silence in TENNY'S CAR. (We recognize the murder scene.) POLICE LIGHTS FLASH in the rearview mirror though STARKS doesn't see them yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and TENNY are talking to one another. TENNY's voic takes a dangerous tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY You ever been to jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY nods, distracting STARKS long enough to slip a hand down his leg to the GUN he's hidden there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY It's worse than war. It's worse than anywhere you've ever been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I doubt it. [Beat] I don't think prison's so bad you don't want to remember it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY carefully pulls over to the side of the road, assur and cautious with each word, each move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY Well, I've never been to war, but I'm sure as hell not going back to prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Finally spotting Harrison] What's he pulling us over for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY [Still preparing himself] Recreation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER HARRISON walks up to their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER HARRISON Gentlemen, I'm gonna need you to step out of the car, with your hands at your side please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER HARRISON [Sternly] Step out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Ok, sir. I was just asking what for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER HARRISON This is a stolen vehicle you're driving. Now put your hands in the air, out where I can see 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the second when OFFICER HARRISON sees where TENNY' HAND is. As he reaches for his own GUN, the situation explodes as TWO FLASHES eclipse all else. OFFICER HARRISO goes down, still holding his own GUN and STARKS jumps out the car to check on him. STARKS Jesus Christ, what'd you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY looks around, still holding the GUN. Starks swallow assessing whether to back away or not. TENNY waves his gu he half points it in Harrison's direction. Then, GUN stil hand, he smirks nervously and looks at STARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY Man, if you're so deaf and dumb, you ain't even worth a fucking bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY raises the gun, then aims it away from STARKS and shoots OFFICER HARRISON once more. From the ground, OFFIC HARRISON fires back and STARKS, now lunging at Tenny, TAK THE HIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS falls, clearly unable to get up, let alone pursue anyone. TENNY smiles sardonically and slowly puts the GUN his back pocket as he turns to leave. This SMILE was one the eerie FLASHES that haunted Starks in the JACKET...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS struggles but can't move. That's when he passes ou looking at OFFICER HARRISON from the ground, as he did in scene before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS stands in the lighted tunnel, which only gets brig as his heart races with fear in the first seconds that he back in there. Then he sees an IMAGE of a WOMAN'S FOREHEA that lulls him to a calm until his heart slows and the LI gradually dims...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS enters the diner, calming down even more as he spo JACKIE. She looks up, holding PLATES in her hand. She's understandably surprised and unexpectedly pleased when sh sees him. She greets him with a small smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops off her orders and then walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I'll be off in 15 minutes. Can you wait till then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and JACKIE smoke in the cold, standing next to the hood of her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE The Jacket. That's what they call it, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE It was banned, you know... and it led to an investigation of Dr. Becker's mistreatment of some of his patients. That's when they found out how badly he was drugging his patients...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Starting to make sense] So he was giving me all kinds of drugs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Nodding] Apparently. He was taking a lot of them, too. It said he was trying out behavior modification treatments that were banned back in the 70s -- "womb treatment" is the name he gave to what he did to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Cutting in] Womb? A fuckin' womb? What kind of animal did he come out of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE But no one knew until after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS After I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Beat] You bled to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I don't know how you got the cut to your head, but you died bleeding from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Digesting] And you're sure my body was found on January 1st?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Do you really believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I don't know. [Beat] I thought I was crazy after you left that day. I died. I still think I could be crazy. But then I replayed that night in my head -- the parts of it I could remember -- and it was like...I don't care if I was, or am. I haven't felt that way in a room with someone my whole life. [Beat] And when you left, all I wanted was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE looks around her; coupled with the cold, her sobri is obvious. STARKS takes hold of her and holds her face c to his so that their foreheads touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Softly] I want to trust you. Should I trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Then we need to figure out what happened to you. It's the only thing we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Alpine Grove still exists. I looked it up on the net. We should go there and see if there's still anyone around who might have known what happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS If they don't take me out before then. [As an afterthought] What's the net?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE looks at him and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are driving through VERMONT to ALPINE GROVE. STARKS looks out the window and watches her drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I didn't kill Officer Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS How? Did they figure it out after I died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE No. They never figured it out. I did. Most murderers don't stop to help a drunk woman and her little girl on the side of the road. Not without hurting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and JACKIE sit opposite DR. MORGAN, the current yo face of the hospital. MORGAN has a boyish face and a matc gullibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MORGAN I'm sorry I can't tell you more about your father's death, Mr. Starks. Our own medical examiners determined only that he died from a blunt trauma to the head but that was right around the time the Alpine Grove's staff changed and I'm afraid we didn't have the best record system before then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS His body was found on January 1, 1993, but do you know if that was long after he had died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MORGAN No, I don't. I'm sorry. I wish I knew more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS What about Dr. Thomas Becker or Dr. Loel Lorenson? There was also a Dr. Gries, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MORGAN Well, Dr. Lorenson is still here at the hospital. If she was here at the time your father was, then I'm sure she'd be of more help to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS What about Dr. Becker and Mr. Gries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MORGAN Unfortunately, I'm not familiar with Dr. Becker and Dr. Gries passed away three, four years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Do you have any kind of forwarding address for Dr. Becker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MORGAN Your father was here 12 years ago. I doubt the hospital would have that, if Dr. Becker is still even alive. [Beat, a little suspiciously] Is there a particular reason you need to know how your father died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS doesn't waver when he answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS He was the only family I remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MORGAN [Nodding] I'll see what I can find out about Dr. Becker. And maybe Dr. Lorenson will know something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. MORGAN leads JACKIE and STARKS through a ward. STARKS looks around in disbelief; it's more like a hospital now it ever was in 1993.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they arrive outside Lorenson's office, MORGAN turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MORGAN Let me just tell her we're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MORGAN goes inside and JACKIE takes STARKS' HAND as t wait. It's hardly more than a couple seconds when LORENSO appears in the doorway. She looks at STARKS curiously and two share a very lengthy, intense STARE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON -- now in her 50s -- walks closer to Starks suspiciously. For his part, STARKS doesn't look as unfami with Lorenson as he should; this doesn't escape Lorenson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Hello. I'm Beth Lorenson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts out a hand that is trembling slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON It's nice to meet you, Mr. Starks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS hesitates before he takes Lorenson's hand. There i something very eerie about the exchange. STARKS quickly l go and LORENSON turns to JACKIE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON And you are...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE looks back uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I'm just William's friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON looks over both of them acutely and then calmly turns to Dr. Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I think we'll be fine from here. Thanks, Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON leans against her desk while STARKS and JACKIE s in the chairs. As they talk, each seems cautious in his exchange -- not knowing what the other one does or doesn' know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON My God you look exactly like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I never knew my father. Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Yeah, I did. [Beat] He was my most memorable patient. STARKS Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON considers her answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON At the end, he made me change my mind about a lot of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You thought my father was crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON No. I don't think he was crazy. He needed help...but he wasn't crazy. [Beat] Your father actually helped me with a case of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON waits to see if STARKS knows what she is talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS What case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I was working with a boy named Eugene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS shows no recognition but JACKIE does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Who was Eugene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Peaked] He was a friend's son. [Beat] Are you familiar with the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Just a little, when we were looking up information about William's father. How did he help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON It's complicated, but [looking at Starks] in a way, your father let me know how I'd get through to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON He just said...that I'd shock Eugene and then things would change for him. JACKIE I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I still don't either, even after all these years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Do you know how my father died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Unconvincingly] I don't know how much I remember but I seem to think it was from a... cut or blow of some sort or another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS How'd he get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Beat] I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS But Dr. Morgan said you were around when my father was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I was. But I saw a lot of cuts and a lot of blows. I'm sorry I don't know more about your father's. [Sincerely] I didn't know about everything that went on here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON says it like she's hiding something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Well, do you think Dr. Becker would have any idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON How do you know about Dr. Becker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS My dad wrote some things down before he died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON looks like she's suddenly remembering something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON That's right. He did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at Lorenson curiously; he doesn't know what Lorenson is talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON So maybe Dr. Becker would know. [Beat] But, as I'm sure you know, the statute of limitations has run out for charging the hospital with any liabilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Why would we do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS just stares at LORENSON, not knowing if he died by this man's hands or not, not knowing who he can trust...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Because Becker resigned after the charges brought against him by State Patient Advocacy Groups. LORENSON I see you've done your homework. [Beat] Alpine Grove's undergone a lot of changes since then. At the time, we didn't have the...resources to help our patients the way we needed to. [Beat] Now, we do. And things are different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I wouldn't be so sure. Like you said about back then, you might not know everything going on around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON looks right at STARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON It's important for you to know who your father was, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] Yeah, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Eerily] It's almost as if your life depended on it. Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Well... [beat] let me know how your search turns out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] We will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and JACKIE walk briskly down it, away from Lorenso office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I don't believe a thing she just said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Me neither. Who was the boy she was talking about, Eugene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I have no idea. JACKIE You think Lorenson kills you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Maybe. I don't know. Seems more likely Becker does, but at the very least she knows how I died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Let's see if they have an address for Becker. I also want to figure out more about the kid you helped her with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Because that's the part I believe is true. You probably did help her somehow with the boy and Eugene's name did come up over and over again on the abstracts I pulled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] There's one more thing I want to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS, determined, now leads JACKIE. As they reach the e of the hall, we see DAMON -- now in his 50s -- look after curiously before he goes back to his work with a PATIENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE watches STARKS ignore the "Authorized Personnel On SIGN as he pushes the door open without so much as a paus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morgue looks exactly as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is momentarily jarred in the room. He looks to the wall on which the JACKET hung and sees only the BARE HOOK that used to hold it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS This was the room. They used to hang the Jacket there. [Turning to Jackie] This is where it happened. This is the room I'm actually in right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE isn't doubtful, but it's also hard to be convinced...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I can show you. It's probably in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS walks to the CADAVER DRAWERS and rests his hands o the one they put him in. Then, with great difficulty -- physical and emotional -- he opens it to see if there is anything left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls it out, and there's nothing in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Maybe this wasn't such a good idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS leans closer, locating all the proof he needs: the stained metal -- still reddened and browned with DRIED BL and the part of the morgue slab he CLAWED his NAILS into he was in it. JACKIE looks at it in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yes, it was. [Softly] My fingers were the only things I could move. [Beat] Dead bodies don't bleed. And they certainly can't claw so hard they dent metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS and JACKIE are leaving the MORGUE, when STARKS spo DAMON, now hardly a hair of the bully he was before. DAMO stares at him curiously; STARKS glares back furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON You folks ain't supposed to be down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE We were just leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON doesn't take his eyes off Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON Do I know you from somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You may have known my father, William Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON smiles, remembering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON That's right! Goddamn, you're the spitting image. I didn't know he had a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS He didn't either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON [With a dirty laugh] I'll be damned. He musta been 12 when he had you. [Beat] You could be his ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Did you know my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON Oh yeah, sure. He killed a cop, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looms strangely over DAMON in this exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You wouldn't happen to know how he died, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON [Slightly apprehensive] No, I don't. I just remember them finding his body. STARKS You don't know any more, Damon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON [Shocked] How'd you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS My father used to talk about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON Oh yeah, what'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon's eyes betray his unease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS He said you were a sadistic fuck that belonged in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON is shocked, and cowed. So much that he shakes as he looks for his bearings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON Look here, I don't like you getting in my face and saying this bullshit to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON I thought you said you never knew your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I didn't. [Beat] Did you have anything to do with his death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON I don't know what you're talking about, man. I swear. This is some weird shit you're telling me... and I don't know how come you're doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS starts to see a shaking man who stands confused an distraught before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS He died because he bled to death from a blow to his head. Someone had to have given him it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON I never touched your father! I swear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon's eyes are filled with dishonesty, tears and a crav FEAR. STARKS leans in closer to DAMON as he remembers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You know something, Damon? You're like a mule. You're real stubborn. But there's ways of fixin' that. All you need is a good stick. [Beat] Here's your stick. Live with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks like he could easily bash Damon's head again the wall, but instead he lets it go and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is standing above his own headstone: WILLIAM STARK December 25, 1967 - January 1, 1993. Next to his grave is of RUDY MACKENZIE. STARKS looks down sadly at both. JACKI comes up behind him. JACKIE How long do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE They told me Becker's in Shelbourne now. I looked him up and he was listed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks scared and lost -- like it's all catching up him. And like he might be being taken out of the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS How far away is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE kisses his SCARS -- from the war and the Jacket -- STARKS lifts her higher so he can look at her as they mak love for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE is lying in STARKS' arms, running her FINGERS over of the SCARS on his chest. STARKS strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE What about Captain Medley? He never told them what happened to you over there. His testimony...that coward wanted them to think you were crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I know. It was perfect. [Beat] Erase my sanity and you erase anything I'll ever say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Frustrated] Well, doesn't what he did to you make you mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Of course it makes me mad. It makes me more than mad. Just like remembering the face of the man who killed that officer and knowing nothing more about him. But what's it gonna do for me to find them now? I can't fix everything in three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE You've got to get yourself out of that place. They're going to kill you if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I might not be able to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE It's not a prison, it's a hospital. There's got to be some way out of there and you've got to find it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't finish because it's too hard to. STARKS nods, wiping her tears and kissing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sore sound of the DRAWER being opened stirs Jackie -- awakening her as if she heard it in her sleep. She reache across the bed, but STARKS is no longer there. She runs h hands over the bed like he's alive in the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON is administering medicine to a patient in th ward, when she sees -- almost like a shadow -- a STRETCHE being wheeled down the hall. She finishes with the patien and runs to the end of the hall in search of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS lies recovering under a small light above his hosp bed. His body bears marks of the brutalization. As we pul back, we see DR. LORENSON standing guard over him at the of his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS sits by a window -- I.V.'s in his arm -- smoking f still severely weak from the Jacket, while DR. LORENSON observes him for a bit from the hall before she goes insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You'll die if you keep smoking those in your condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'll die either way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON pulls up a chair and sits opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I can't try to help you unless you let me. [Beat] I know about the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS waits to see what this means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I'm sorry for what you were put through, and I'm sorry I couldn't stop it earlier. But I promise you that I will from now on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Cutting him off] I don't want you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You have no idea what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON No, I do. That's what I'm saying to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Listen to me! You don't! The Jacket is my only chance in this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON just thinks it's another delusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON How can you say that in your physical condition? Do you realize that it's because you were put in it that you're as...weak as you are now? Becker's a man who's not well himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS searches for words that won't sound as crazy as he knows he appears. They don't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Then help me understand. You know, you're not alone. A lot of Gulf Vets have begun to experience curious symptoms. What you have might well be a syndrome and, if so, it's not one we know enough about to be treating it this vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS This has nothing to do with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Exasperated] Then what? What? [Beat] I can't guess it. You have to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS fixes his eyes on Lorenson. He has nothing to lose still he treads carefully. The words that follow come alm unwittingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS ...What you do not know is the only thing you know. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS (cont'd) [Beat] And what you own is what you do not own... And where you are is where you are not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Beat] Where is that from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as though STARKS hears his words for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I don't know. [Frustrated] Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Come on. Tell me what you do know. STARKS [Beat] I've seen a time that's not this time. And I'm only able to see it when I'm in the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Well, what time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON nods, trying to mask his dismay but failing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You don't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Testing him] Well, what year do you think it is now? STARKS [Exasperated] I'm not delusional. I know it's 1992. Same as every sane person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Ok fine. Tell me about it. Tell me about the future. 2004. What does it look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS It doesn't look all that different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON The future doesn't look different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No. Not for people like me. [Beat] Not in the places I come from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON What about the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I didn't see that much of it -- same as now. I only saw it as part of my own life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON looks at STARKS, unintentionally patronizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Do you think you're traveling in time? Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS shakes his head and momentarily challenges Lorenso simply with his air of calm resolve. STARKS Not everyone in here is crazy, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON searches for another approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Beat] Like who? Like MacKenzie maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Matter-of-factly] Did he tell you he tried to kill his wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON MacKenzie locked himself up in his house for two months and nearly starved himself to death before he was brought here. All because his wife left him for another man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS moves to put his cigarette out and his I.V. almost falls out of his arm. LORENSON makes a move to adjust it STARKS flinches perceptibly, startling LORENSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Adjusting it himself] Maybe that just makes him weak, not crazy. Or maybe he is crazy. [Beat] Still doesn't make me think I am. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Adjusting it himself] And, judging by the fact that you just told me about another patient, it doesn't even make you think I am, so what don't you work on persuading yourself first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Why don't you help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Because I don't have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm about to die unless I do something to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON And how do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Because of the future. I know what's going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON William, that is just another facet of my delusions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, STARKS remembers the only thing that might help him pauses, trying to recall as much of it as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS And what about your work with Eugene -- the kid? Is that another facet of my delusions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON -- having prepared to continue -- is bowled over the mention of her patient. She loses all color and calm her features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON How do you know about Eugene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You told me about him. I saw you and I think you thought I knew something about him. So you told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Somewhat angrily] How do you know about Eugene!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Shaking his head in disbelief] You told me. It's like two parts of you talking through me. Look, judging from your reaction, there's no other way I could know about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON There obviously is, so what don't you just tell me how you found out about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at her convincingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Some part of you suspects -- even if you don't know for sure -- that what I'm saying is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I don't know how you know about Eugene, but these ideas are part of your delusions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS NO! They're not my delusions! Look, just leave my business with Becker to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON One thing's got nothing to do with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS One's got everything to do with the other. So unless you want my blood on your hands...leave what's between me and Becker between me and Becker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON backs off, jarred by Starks' assertions and fear of his debilitating vehemence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE sits idly on one of the hallway benches until t hallway is clear of the STAFF. Then he scuttles quickly - the time close to the wall -- to Starks' room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE gets inside, ducks as a NURSE passes and then t lightly on the wall, announcing himself gladly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE Hey, I brought you some smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS doesn't waste any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Lorenson said your wife left you for another man and that's when you lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE almost imperceptibly winces -- confirming the t for Starks -- before he has to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE Geez, how's that for a fucking "thank you"? STARKS Is it true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE tosses him the CIGARETTES and lights himself on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE She left me, I tried to kill her, I tried to kill myself. She was mean, I was weak, I was cruel so she left, I didn't plan it, didn't see it...FINE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE suddenly stops, distraught. When he resumes, it in an oddly more normal tone than he's ever used before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE [Softly] I didn't want to see it. I'm in here because they say I have a nervous condition. [Beat] Well, here's my question, who wouldn't be nervous if they really looked at their life? [Beat] Whose life is that good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS doesn't have an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE Not this luckless little mammal's. What difference is it to them? [Beat, slows down] You believe what you want to believe. One version is easier than another so you make it your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As MacKenzie runs his hand over his forehead, he looks hu and sad, but strangely not a bit crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE I'll tell you this though. However nuts I am, I wasn't nuts enough not to know how wrong it was to put a human being in something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE's twitching continues as he recollects it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS MacKenzie, [beat] what if we are crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE [Shrugging] What if we are? There're crazier things than thinking up fictions for yourself. [Beat] Everyone does it, don't they? Even Becker. That roller coaster car pops more pills than all of Ward 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Becker does? Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE I've been here for 11 years. It's my neighborhood. 'Course I'm sure. He's as drugged up as the rest of us...I guess he has to be to put up with all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods and MacKenzie puts his head down, suddenly vulnerable and embarrassed. STARKS lights TWO CIGARETTES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Thanks for the cigarettes. You still got a lot of problems, MacKenzie, but you're ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE and STARKS smoke together quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. STARKS' ROOM, ALPINE GROVE, DECEMBER 29th, 1992

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is trying to see if the windows open through the b covering them. It's especially hard with the I.V. still connected to one of his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER At least it's some kind of bars we've got you behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS turns, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Hello, William. I understand you've been asking for me almost every hour. I would've been here sooner but you gave our little state visitor quite a bit to talk to me about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER It is. But when it comes down to it, you just have to patient with them. They'd rather have their vacation, too, so they just push dealing with our "practices" off to the New Year. STARKS They make it hard for you to get away with your business, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Temporarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS lights a cigarette and, with that gesture, adopts unscrupulousness of a criminal so convincingly it bears little resemblance to his usual demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Makes it a little easier for me to get away with mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER looks at STARKS seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER And what's that? STARKS My business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Getting away with things. Like whatever I may or may not have gotten away with Officer Harrison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER You killed him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS simply delivers one slow nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS And wound up in a better cage. [Beat] But I still want to make a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER looks understandably disgusted and STARKS proceeds with the calculation of someone who is guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS See, the deluxe lab animal treatment I've been receiving -- well, I don't think it's worked. I woke up today and realized... [eerily lowering his voice] ...I don't think I'm cured. So really, what was the point? Torture? I think that's still sort of illegal in some states -- though we'll have to check on Vermont. And, how's this for the cherry on top: it seems my physician is a pill-popping freak. [Beat] Last time I checked, that makes some pretty good copy for a lot of these news shows. [Humbly, deftly] "I don't remember everything they did to me. I just remember the worst parts." I think I should be sitting down when I say it, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes BECKER some seconds to swallow this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I think...I have to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER cocks his head to one side as he does. Then he slo makes his way over to STARKS and leans in closer to him. STARKS instinctively raises his hand to his HEAD -- prepa to be defensive if he has to be. If this is the moment wh he's killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But BECKER only YANKS the I.V. angrily out of Starks' arm tearing his skin with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I think your story needs a little fleshing out before it's ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER turns to leave as STARKS bleeds onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I'll say a prayer for you in Church today, Starks. Maybe the Gods can pick up where the medicine left off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You sure you know where to find one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I've managed to every Sunday of my life. [Beat] Some of us are God- fearing men, Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS And what does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Means we believe in doing his work and fear what the world would be like if we didn't at least try to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS smirks at the hypocrisy he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Becker, how do you sleep at night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER You in here. [Beat] Works like a drug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER leaves without looking back and STARKS closes his eyes, breathing a sigh of relief that it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON, dressed to leave, stops to talk to NINA, one of evening nurses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Nina, William Starks is to stay in ICU all night. If anything is supposed to change, I want to be called about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Sure, Dr. Lorenson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON comes home to an unremarkable apartment to find thin, young mother, TALIA YAZDI, and her eleven year-old mute, and seemingly retarded son, EUGENE, waiting for her outside her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Hi. [Beat] Sorry I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA It's ok. [To Eugene] Hi, Eugene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
