dialogues.text: EUGENE returns her greeting with a blank stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON sets her things down on the kitchen table as TAL starts to tidy things around the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Talia, I need to ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA looks at LORENSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Have you told anyone about my sessions with Eugene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA [With an accent] Of course not. [Off Lorenson's still doubtful look] I swear I haven't. I wouldn't do that to Eugene, or you. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Has anyone been asking about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA No. I would have told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON nods. She believes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS spots DAMON standing cautiously in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see (but don't hear) HARDING speak to NINA as DAMON sl into STARKS' ROOM. NINA seems sufficiently distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON flashes a KNIFE at STARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON No funny business or we can make this a lot fucking harder for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One look at the KNIFE and the SAME QUESTION burns once mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Weakly] No funny business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON hustles Starks down the hall as fast as they can be the NURSE or any other staff member spots them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EUGENE sits opposite LORENSON, who quietly observes him, jotting some notes down on her pad. She is intermittently holding up PICTURES for Eugene, asking him to repeat thei names as if she were teaching him to read. LORENSON Eugene, this is a "TRAIN."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EUGENE starts to pronounce the word when abruptly, and without any warning, he looks like he's unconscious, only with a blank stare. Lorenson quickly moves beside Eugene watches him from up close, apparently not altogether surprised at what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EUGENE doesn't even blink. The only sounds we hear from h are a couple, barely audible guttural noises. LORENSON -- exhausted -- takes off her glasses wearily and gently addresses the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Come on back down here. Wherever you are...try to come on back. You'll like it, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, TALIA walks in with TEA, JUICE and COOKIES for Eugene and Lorenson. She spots her son in his absent, sta state and forces her face into a small, sad smile to avoi tears as she sets the tray down and the cookies before th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA gently touches LORENSON'S hand. LORENSON looks at h warmly. TALIA knows how hard she's trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER soundlessly watches as HARDING and DAMON finish strapping Starks in the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAMON slams the DRAWER shut, sending STARKS back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What STARKS lacks in strength, he counteracts with his OVERWHELMING WILL. The SCREEN TREMBLES with it. One TERRI WHITE LIGHT and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS sits by himself in Jackie's car, parked in a gas station. He looks around, trying to make sure it really i her car. He looks in the back and sees a pair of sneakers an empty BOTTLE of VODKA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks outside and sees a few people walking into the F MART of the gas station. He trembles with cold as he look down at his plaid shirt. Then, JACKIE unexpectedly appears outside the DRIVER'S WI opening the car door and nearly spilling her COFFEE when spots STARKS next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing it's him though, she smiles warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE You just scared me, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans over to him and gives him a kiss, handing him t coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Here, drink this. I'll get the heat going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE speeds through the streets of Shelbourne, presumab on their way to Becker's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've slowed down a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE reads from some directions on a PAPER as their CAR slows down on one particular street, towards one particul house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [O.S.] I think this is his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at the house, bedecked with a lopsided SNOW on the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Yeah. I called the number yesterday to make sure. Thomas Becker, retired

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS knocks on the door. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE tries to look through the windows to see if anyone there. No one is. It looks small and dark inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS knocks again, looking down anxiously at his feet. JACKIE walks up to him from around the side of the house. They don't have the time to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE They're not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS They're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Beat, lost] No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE notices how COLD Starks looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Maybe they're out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS rubs his hands together as he looks out the window and sees NO CARS or PEOPLE on the street. JACKIE watches despairingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE How much time do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Distracted] I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE What? What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS There're no cars on this street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE looks around; there really aren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Yeah, you're right. But wait, how can that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS turns to JACKIE, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I don't know. Maybe that's because this whole thing is a dream. How can you have a street with no cars on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I don't know. But this isn't a dream. I'm real, and so is where we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Then why isn't there anyone around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Beat] I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS runs his hand over his head and closes his eyes in desperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE William! William!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS opens his eyes. She sighs in relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Maybe he's gone somewhere. He'll have to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS starts to shake his head in disbelief, when sudden he realizes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Of course he will. [Beat] What day of the week is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE It's Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Nodding] It's Sunday. JACKIE So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks ecstatic with hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Look where these people live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, beautiful, removed place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS They've got lives to be grateful for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE William, you're not making sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] They're at Church. And I bet that's where Becker is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE and STARKS head back to the only MAIN STREET in th town. As they approach the town church, they start to see ROW of cars parallel-parked on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE pulls up to the entrance of the CHURCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS watches JACKIE get out of the car and walk up to t doors of the CHURCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE boldly opens the CHURCH door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE sees the town seated in the Church. The PRIEST loo up at her briefly and some people turn around, but she cl the DOOR before she causes a major interruption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move to the third or fourth row, where, from behind, w see a head of GREY HAIR. He slowly turns around, casting look towards the door and revealing a glimpse of his face Though it's aged slightly, it hasn't softened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE and STARKS watch as the people file out of Church. They are leaning against her car when STARKS spots him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. BECKER walks beside a SMALL CHILD -- presumably his GRANDSON. JACKIE registers his formidableness with some surprise; Becker's maintained a strong physique and is ha a shade less intimidating than he was before. Only his ha has a permanent shake now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS doesn't waste any time. He heads straight for him. Almost sensing him, BECKER looks in his direction. The ca look on his face is instantly supplanted by one of DISBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You still go to Church. How's that work? Your God just doesn't notice? That it? [Beat, serious] How you doin', Dr. Becker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER stops walking and looks at Starks. His GRANDSON lo at him. BECKER'S GRANDSON Grandpa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Still looking at Starks] Sean, why don't you wait for me by the car? I'll be there in a minute. [Turning to the kid] Ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His grandson, momentarily appeased, heads for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [To Starks] Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I don't know, Dr. Becker. Can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough to confirm for BECKER who STARKS is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All around them, people leaving Church socialize routinel unaware of the haunted history being made between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I think you know. Your eyes say you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Beat] You're his son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No. I'm not his son. I'm him. [Beat] What? You look like you've seen a ghost. You can come here and touch me, old man. I'm the real thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER How...how are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at Becker -- each a terrifying reminder of t other's past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER You died, Starks. Years ago, in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I know. [Beat] You killed me, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER No. I didn't. I swear I didn't. I probably helped push you to kill yourself, but I didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I didn't kill myself. I died from a blow to the head. How'd it happen? I have to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER looks at him, nearly too stunned to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I don't know how you died. The last time I put you in the Jacket was just after you told me you remembered killing that police officer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I didn't say I remembered killing him. I just repeated some words to get myself back in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I know. [Beat] I knew that when you came out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Because...because you came out and said something you couldn't have possibly have known. You came back and repeated three names...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER falters as he recalls his offenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER Of people like you. People I was just trying to help. They couldn't get worse so I thought, with medication, they might get...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Medication? What kind of meds do you chase with nights in a cadaver drawer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER It was part of the treatment I intended...I didn't know what the effects would be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS So, what, you guinea pig sick people to find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER The three of you weren't regular patients. You were criminals that ended up at Alpine Grove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No, we were patients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER concedes after all this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER You and the others didn't seem that way then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is quiet as he comes to understand how it's about work out: if Becker tells him those names now, he essenti indicts himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Who were the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER remembers with a hint of remorse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Racked with remorse] Nathan Piechowski, Jackson MacGregor, and Ted Casey. [Beat] I didn't ask for you -- for any of you. You were all sent to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at Becker, in astonishment. BECKER What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS just stares at Becker, waiting for the realization hit him, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER How did you come to know their names?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You just told me. The last time I was with you was when I was in the Jacket. I'm in it right now, Dr. Becker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm in it as we speak. [Beat] You're haunting yourself right now. [Beat] I guess sometimes we indict ourselves if no one else does. You didn't make history like you wanted to, huh, Dr. Becker. It turned out different, didn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER I didn't put you in Alpine Grove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No. [Beat] You put me on drugs and then you put me in the Jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER [Stoically] I was sorry when I heard you died. I was, but...how was I to know you didn't shoot that police officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS The same way you just said I didn't without my ever telling you. [Beat] And that still doesn't excuse what you did. Just because you had keys to a cage didn't mean you had animals inside. [Beat] You've earned your guilt, Becker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS shares a last look with Becker before he walks awa towards the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE and STARKS sit inside the parked car as STARKS tou his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE That's all you got from him? That bastard helped take your life away from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No, he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE What? How can you say that? He's the one that put you in that goddamn medieval...Jacket. He's probably the one who killed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with those words, JACKIE starts to break down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No one's killing anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS takes her hand and runs it over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Touch me. I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at her with love, understanding and, for the first time, a sense of peace. He strokes her hair to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS If everything hadn't happened the way it has, then I wouldn't be here right now, sitting in a car with you, touching your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Why are you saying that? [Beat] We don't have long, do we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at her without answering. JACKIE wipes her e fastens STARKS' seat belt, and seeing that Starks' EYES h started to flutter, starts driving. In the distance, the barely audible sound of the DRAWER opening, and their tim ending, is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE To the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE and STARKS speed on the highway. As STARKS sleeps, JACKIE keeps looking over at him like it's a way to make he stays with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE helps STARKS -- who's severely weakened at this po to the nurse's station. CLAIRE is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Claire, I need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE helps JACKIE, and they take him into a room. From afar, we hear CLAIRE asking about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS What's happening to me? Why am I getting so much weaker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Because your body can only take so much of what they're putting you through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE Jesus, what's happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE helps CLAIRE do for STARKS what they can; it doesn seem like much at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Lorenson's the only one that could let me out of there. I need something to persuade her that I was there. Get me something to take to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Ok. Ssh. Rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE stands above a PRINTER as it prints the informatio she's looked up about Dr. Lorenson. The PAPER gets jammed and that's when JACKIE completely loses it. She WRESTLES the printer as if it were responsible for what's happenin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she realizes she's not alone. She looks back and see CLAIRE, watching from the doorway, with a sympathetic loo her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [In a panic] He's not...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE No, no. [Beat] Not yet. But he doesn't have long. Are you sure you don't want a doctor to look at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE No! It won't do any good. [Beat] Please, Claire. They won't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE acquiesces with her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is trapped: back on the day when Officer Harrison murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cont'd from the scene after STARKS left Jean and Jackie' place):

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is walking back on the same highway just after the has set, and just after he helped JEAN and JACKIE, on tha fateful day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time we see a CAR stop for him from a much closer distance. TENNY pulls up towards STARKS and rolls down th window on the passenger side. STARKS bends down to be abl see the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY Hey, Mister, you need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY I'm going to Canada but I can let you ride with me up to the border.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY Can you drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY Great, get in. We'll switch off in a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back and see the same SHOT, from a distance, of STARKS putting his BAG in the back and getting in. As he opens the CAR DOOR, we hear the MUSIC playing inside. As drive off, the MUSIC fades further and further in the distance as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the night that they slept together, and the departur never saw. We see, from Starks' POV, JACKIE sleeping serenely in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We catch one glimpse of STARKS in the moonlight, standing naked in the doorway, before he turns and then...disappea having been taken out of the Jacket at that point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE is by STARKS' side, lying on the hospital bed, nex him, smoothing his sweating head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE William, please, honey, wake up. For me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS' eyes flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods; JACKIE tries to continue without choking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I found out about Eugene. The little boy. He's the key. That's who you have to tell her about when you get back there. It's the only way to prove this to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE's VOICE fades as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON watches EUGENE continue to look unresponsively in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is awake, watching JACKIE sleep wearily on his che He sees the TOLL this has taken on her, just as he senses is about to be taken out of the Jacket. He nudges her gen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Jackie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE stirs her eyes to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Somewhat urgently] Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS When we first met, when you were 7, where was the house you lived in with your mother? Do you remember your address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE 112 Orchard Way. [Realizing, in a whisper] You're not coming back, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS, faint, struggles to get out of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You gotta stop thinking like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Then, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Nowhere. [Beat] I just think I'm gonna be sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS   moves towards the bathroom of the hospital room. JACKIE   moves to help him and he motions for her to stop STARKS   falters in the doorway when he turns to look bac Jackie   -- like it might be for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [In a whisper] You come back to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods, then goes in and closes the door behind him. JACKIE stares after him -- alone in the total silence of room. She listens for the slightest noise and that's when actually hears the sound of the DRAWER being opened for herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She realizes he's gone. She RUSHES after him, opens the d in a fit, and then, sees what she feared most: no sign of Starks. JACKIE falls to her knees, right there, on the bathroom floor and cries out like a woman only beginning realize how unfathomably deep her heart is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is suddenly in the waiting area outside Lorenson's office -- still severely weakened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks slowly to the OFFICE DOOR and feebly knocks. LORENSON answers and STARKS falls into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Stunned] Oh dear God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON has laid STARKS down on the COUCH in her office. STARKS can barely talk. He spews as much of it as he can in his feverish state...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm William Starks. I'm not his son. And...and the kid you work with. Your friend's son...Eugene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON is stilled by the words STARKS just spoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I know. I know it all. Save your strength. I already know everything you're going to say. [Beat] You're in the Jacket right now, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS How...how do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You told me this was how it happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS clutches his side in pain as they prepare to take out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Who...who kills me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You have nothing to fear, William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when we look to see STARKS' reaction, he's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER is dressed to leave the hospital when he suddenly decides not to. He takes off his coat and his gloves, but his SCARF, and walks out of his office with a decided urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER pulls STARKS out of the drawer and looks down ruef at STARKS' scathed face. STARKS, drenched in BLOOD and SW seeks the outline of Becker's face in the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Whispering] Becker, I know about you. [Beat] I know what you did to your patients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER looses the straps around Starks' neck to help him speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Nathan...Piechowski. [Beat] Jackson MacGregor...Ted Casey. [Beat] You didn't cure them. You killed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKER momentarily loses color and his forever cool mien. After some seconds, STARKS passes out and BECKER -- hands trembling -- looks as though he might stick him back in w instead, he starts to remove him from the Jacket himself. silently and carefully unties each of the straps -- takin unusual care for Starks' flesh as he prepares to put him stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the SUN starts to rise, we see STARKS -- now cleaned u recovering in his bed. He is unconscious. From his window look down and see Dr. Lorenson's car pulling into the lot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON, still wearing her winter gear, walks into Stark room, anxiously checking his VITALS. Her anxious expressi reveals Starks' frailty. She looks to the window then and sees an empty chair with only Becker's SCARF on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON goes to the window in time to see BECKER getting into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS lies unconscious in the bed. The NURSE, SALLY, sto by the room to check on Dr. Lorenson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLY Would you like anything, Dr. Lorenson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON A cup of coffee would be great, Sally. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLY Is he gonna be ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SALLY Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON looks after her as she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON wakes up as STARKS stirs in his sleep, slowly wa up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You're going to be ok, William. We just need to get your fever down and we'll be able to hopefully stabilize you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Who are you kidding, Doc? You or me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Can I get some paper and something to write with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Solemnly] I'm starting to think I'm really gonna die soon. So I'd like to write some things down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I'm not gonna let that happen. STARKS You still don't believe me, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON I do believe you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No. Listen to me...the kid, Eugene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON still gets taken aback by Starks' knowledge of Eugene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No one knows you're working with him so how would I have found out? He's your friend's son, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true; no one could have known about Lorenson's priva life. STARKS coughs, clearly in great pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON William, I can't indulge these delusions, even when you're in this state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Listen to me. That's all I ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON has no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS He's having absence [pronounced "absance"] seizures when he stares off into space like he does. He has them so often that that's why he hasn't learned to speak properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Who told you this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You did, in the future. You figured it out because a part of you already knows this. That's how it works. [Beat] I'm just telling you something you already know, even if you haven't realized it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS closes his eyes, gathering what strength he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I don't know when it'll happen but soon I think, you'll shock the boy and it'll wake him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You'll figure it out and you'll do good by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all STARKS can manage before LORENSON sees he's ab to pass out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON answers the KNOCK at her door. It's EUGENE and TALIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Finding it hard to explain] Nothing. [Beat] I don't know. I thought of something I could try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON looks at TALIA helplessly. TALIA nods and leads Eugene inside. LORENSON can't help but look down the hall make sure no one's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON sits across from EUGENE, holding up a picture of DOG. Between them is a tray of MILK and COOKIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Come on Eugene, try to say it with me. This is a "DOG".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EUGENE D--d---d----.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Eugene can't hold the sound of the letter long enough make the word. An absence seizure takes hold of him as he looks out unconsciously into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON moves closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Softly] What's happening to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON checks Eugene's pulse and leans in close to the boy's unconscious face like the answer is there if she ju looks hard enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Are you having a seizure? Is that really what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON spots a corner of Eugene's EYE twitching slightl and, rushing to get a better look, takes the shade off of nearby LAMP and holds it above his head so she can get a better look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, TALIA opens the door, startling Lorenson. She knocks over the MILK and, as it spills on the LAMP CORD - on Eugene's lap -- it causes an ELECTRIC SHOCK. Eugene ca it. TALIA gasps and Lorenson watches the boy in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment passes and Eugene -- more responsive than he h ever been before -- looks at his mother and Lorenson. He doesn't know what's happened but he is aware, and awake, like never before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EUGENE picks right up where he and Lorenson left off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EUGENE Dog. [To Talia] Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA and LORENSON look at him and each other at shock. STARKS [O.S., distantly] You're going to...shock the boy and then things will change for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You ok, Eugene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EUGENE holds Lorenson's gaze steadily for a few moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Stunned himself] Yeah, you are ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON [Putting the pieces together] He got a little shock. [To himself] And it's reset him. Not permanently probably...but at least for a little while. They use it on epileptic patients sometimes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA But he's not epileptic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON No, but he is having seizures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA looks at LORENSON. She's still confused. LORENSON's merely surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks up from his PAPER -- now covered in WORDS -- see Dr. Lorenson in the doorway. STARKS still looks weak much better than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS It worked, didn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS This is really happening, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON [Beat] What do you need me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS folds the LETTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I need to get this letter to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON I can't take you out of here in your condition...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS And I can't stay here in my condition. I am going to die tonight. It's already been decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON No, it hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Yes. [Beat] It has. Everything up 'till today is done. Everything starting with tomorrow is up for grabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON helps STARKS into the parking lot as it snows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON and STARKS are driving on the same, now familiar highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You know how to get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON Sure. It's an easy address. A little far out there, but easy enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Dylan plays on the RADIO. STARKS smiles as he hears h and turns the music up; the act is sad because, as LORENS notices, it belongs to someone with an interest to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. LORENSON and STARKS drive up to Jean and Jackie's hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON You want me to come with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS No, I'll be ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS slowly makes his way to their front door and knock it as best as he can. The sound, however, is still understandably soft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS waits and then reaches for the knob on the door. H opens it and looks inside. We first see his face, and the devastation on it, as we guess the sight he's laid eyes o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE is sitting at the kitchen table, still only 7 year old. Though STARKS expected it, he falters under the disappointment of seeing a girl he liked instead of the w he loved. As she looks up at him, it's all he can do not break down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Surprised] Hey. [Beat] I remember you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I remember you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS shakes his head, looking at her. She looks beautif and still hopeful. Her life lays ahead of her and her fat when he found her in 2004 -- remains as distant as possib from this innocent, still promising image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Jackie, how have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE smiles; she doesn't get asked that often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE I've been ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Good. How's your mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Ok, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS nods. JACKIE smiles. It's all he can do not to crumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Do you think I could see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him and senses, like kids do, the desperatio his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE calls out for Jean, then runs up the stairs to get her. LORENSON has gotten out of the car and is waiting outside on the porch. STARKS remains in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some seconds later, JEAN appears -- gaunt but in a slight better state than we saw her before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Hey, Jean. Nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN looks a little confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN I'm sorry? Your face looks awfully familiar, I just can't quite place it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Mom, this is the guy that drove us home that afternoon we were stuck on the highway. The guy you yelled at for no good reason...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN Oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a once over, and, seeing how weakened he lo decides intuitively he can't be much harm. She also notic LORENSON waiting by the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN There something you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You could say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at JACKIE, hesitating because of her. Sensin this, JEAN asks Jackie to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN Jackie, go play in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE leaves and walks to the yard. STARKS watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I can't stay long. [Motioning to Lorenson] That's my doctor and I gotta get back to the hospital. Everything I want to say is in this letter. [Beat] You can check as much of it as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS hands her the LETTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I won't be around when you read it...but I hope you believe it. It'd be a real shame if you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN looks baffled but, seeming to grasp his urgency, nod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] I should be on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE has been watching this exchange from the shed. Whe looks over there, he catches her eye and CALLS OUT, with strength he has left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Bye, Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the hardest words STARKS has probably ever had say. JACKIE just stares after him, as does JEAN, as he sh himself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Happy New Year to both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN Thanks. You, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As STARKS is walking away, we see his eyes begin to tear the cold -- but not from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE abruptly runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Hey, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS stops in his tracks; he clears as much sadness fro his face as he can before he turns around to face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS [Beat] You be good to yourself, Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, suddenly, she sticks her hand for him to shake, as did that day on the roadside; only now, it trembles sligh in the cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS takes JACKIE'S HAND and holds it in his own softly affectionately. JEAN and DR. LORENSON look on curiously a STARKS looks in her face, at her hand in his, and then to heavens for the means to get through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As STARKS lets go at last, JACKIE looks back at him, sens the connection even if she doesn't know it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS turns and stumbles as he walks back to his car. LORENSON moves to help him, but STARKS tells her not to w his eyes. He makes his way to the car on his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN sits down and starts to open the LETTER. Starks' voi as we hear it now, is presumably from parts of the LETTER he's written to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORENSON looks over to STARKS, who stares painfully out t window. They drive on in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS (V.O.) I was 25 years old the first time I died. It didn't end anything though. [Beat] Sometimes I think we live through things only to be able to tell them, to bear witness, to say this happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS walks back through the gates of the hospital, despondently returning inside, with LORENSON at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS (V.O.) And it wasn't to someone else. It was to me. And I lived despite it. Sometimes I think we live to beat the odds. And sometimes I agree that life can only begin with the knowledge of death. That it can all end, even when you least want it to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACKENZIE looks up from his game of solitaire as LORENSON helps STARKS down the hall. He holds up his hand in the gesture of hello, or goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS raises his hand back with an earnest smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm telling you my story because it's the only way I can try to help your daughter, and you, have a better one of your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see BECKER taking his DRUGS. In his dark den, on his w desk, is a bottle of WHISKEY. He closes his eyes as he administers to himself whatever aid he can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN is reading each page avidly, affected by this man's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS (V.O.) It's scary...and lucky...how much we can forget. Scary because we think the past gives us our bearing, and lucky because in those moments I'm talking about, you realize it doesn't. And it never had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TENNY (Officer Harrison's murderer) is at the bar orderin drink from the BARTENDER. As he gets his DRINK, he slaps BILL down on the counter and turns around to survey the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE rummages in a box of her personal belongings, look for something specific in them. She stops finally when sh finds STARKS' DOG TAGS. She takes them out slowly and put them around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS (V.O.) I am not a crazy man, even though they mistook me for one. I live in the same world as the rest of you. Only I saw more of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, after a moment of staring down at them, she tucks t under her sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN MEDLEY holds a beer as he stares blankly at a TV broadcasting news about MIKE TYSON'S RAPE CONVICTION. Medley's barely watching the footage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Lorenson helps Starks back to bed. STARKS looks up at Lorenson, thanking her without words but with his eyes. LORENSON smiles as she looks back sadly at Starks' even m weakened self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS (V.O.) And the seeing is the only way you can hear what the truth around you is saying: you can always start believing in things you don't already believing in. And, while you're alive, it's never too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he turns and walks out, closing the door so that Sta room and the screen darken at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PAIRS of legs walk down a corridor, darkened by the night, through the now familiar passage to the basement..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS is not restrained this time though we don't see wh walking down the hall with him. He runs his hand over his forehead and looks at it when he's done. STILL NO CUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slow down their pace as they round the corner, as ST appears dizzier and dizzier. He doesn't stop and the PERS beside him doesn't see how weak he is... until STARKS TRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In slow motion, we hear a DISTANT, GARBLED VOICE CALL OUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISTORTED VOICE No! Wa...atch out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But STARKS' head hits the GLASS CASE of the FIRE EXTINGUI on the wall, as it was destined to. In the terrific SHOWE GLASS, one PIECE cuts a neat, deep, fatal GASH in Starks' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOOD starts to flow. As STARKS' eyes struggle to regain their focus, we see the BLURRED, indiscernible FACE of th PERSON leaning over him to see if he's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The details start to make sense, even to Starks. This is WOUND they said he died from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS collapses on the familiar slab, ready to be strapp into the Jacket one final time. BLOOD pours from his head onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PERSON with him struggles to get all of Starks' weigh onto the metal slab. She's doing it as carefully, and gen as she can -- taking observable care with every strap of JACKET, almost as if the act itself is a humane one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the HANDS finally reach the straps around his neck a the hardest part of the struggle has passed, STARKS smile kindly, and thankfully, into the single overhead LIGHT in room that obscures the face of the person strapping him i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the drawer is pushed in, one of the STRAPS gets caught the side, CUTTING STARKS' ARM. We hear a small CRY in the room. Then the HANDS adjust the strap and slowly push STA in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more beautiful and serene inside than it's ever been before. This time, as he travels through the tunnel, it's though he's traveling in a heaven of his own. The IMAGES sees are the best moments of his past -- connected in a tranquil, fluid narrative that suggest STARKS has finally retrieved his memory without it haunting him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS (V.O.) I promise you, Jean. No matter how bad the days and things around you look, they look better awake than they do asleep. I can offer you some proof: when you die, there's only one thing you want to have happen...sometimes so badly it comes true, I guess. [Beat] You want to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PANELS we saw briefly are completed further now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) C.U. A WOMAN'S NECK as a small child's HAND touches it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: aged 9, running up the stairs, knocking a PICTURE on the with his elbow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3) C.U. A black and white PHOTOGRAPH of Starks' father, a much older version of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4) EXT. CREEK: A shot of clear water that's not to deep a on its surface, the reflection of a TEENAGE BOY'S FACE be he touches it and sends it rippling... 5) EXT. A NEW ENGLAND BEACH: STARKS (20s) dressed in a bl suit, holding an URN, letting the ASHES fly into the wate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6) EXT. DESERT: A SANDSTORM WHIRLS round before it's repl with... EXT. VERMONT: A FIELD of snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see now that it was DR. LORENSON who put Starks in. Exhausted from the physical strain of getting him in ther she stares at the closed drawer, like looking at it is on way to look after Starks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN puts down STARKS' LETTER and walks out of the kitche and watches JACKIE sitting absently on the couch, looking past the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN kneels wordlessly beside her daughter and looks her daughter in the eye. JACKIE looks back curiously as JEAN wraps her arms around Jackie's LEGS and rests her head in lap, holding onto her with the dearness of having narrowl missed a tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the sounds of CARS slushing in the snow, an IMAGE fa up slowly on the screen, until we see it's STARKS, standi in the parking lot outside the diner once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time he seems situated, and hopeful. After a slightl longer wait than the first time, JACKIE walks out -- in t same way as before except that she wears a NURSE'S UNIFOR and an unmistakable air of vitality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie looks directly at Starks and we see the same attraction between them teeming even more than before. Ev as a physically injured man in jeans and a flannel, with BLEEDING CUT on his head and no coat in the cold, STARKS someone we see she wants to be near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we see JACKIE as STARKS does: she looks beautiful, alive, happy and just like the woman he never wanted to leave. She approaches Starks warmly, less suspicious of t world -- and less devastated by it -- than we remember he being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Hey there. [Beat] You ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS revels in the moment. In their reunion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE You're bleeding pretty bad there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS touches his FOREHEAD in a panic and, seeing the BL on his hands, looks up at her, terrified. Sensing this, s moves closer to calm him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE It's ok. It's ok. Relax. It's just a cut. We can get it fixed. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE (cont'd) But we need to get you to the hospital now. How'd you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I fell down. [Beat] But I'm alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS looks at her -- immensely relieved and grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Laughing a little] Yes, you are alive. But, listen, it's New Year's Day. You're not going to get a cab. Especially not here. And you're gonna freeze if you stand out here in the snow much longer. I'm on my way back to my shift at the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS You work there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE [Gesturing to her uniform] Yeah, I'm a nurse. Why don't you let me give you a ride...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS falters slightly as he walks. JACKIE helps him mak to the car, much like before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS can hardly keep his eyes off her when her CELL PHO suddenly rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Sorry, one sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE answers it, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Hey! How are you? [Beat] Thanks. I was just thinking about you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS listens nervously to her conversation and the affection in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Listen, I gotta go, mom, 'cause I'm late... but, thanks. Happy New Year to you, too. I'll call you later. [Beat] Ok, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE hangs up and looks at Starks -- feeling a little awkward after the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE Sorry about that. It was my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS smiles back warmly at her; he gets it more than sh knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS Nothin' to worry about there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie's car pulls onto the highway, alongside the other, more modern cars on the highway. JACKIE (O.S.) How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARKS I'm doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The happy sound of their engine on the highway continues, uninterrupted, for some seconds, before, first faintly th louder, we hear a racking, all too familiar sound: the DR creaking as it's opened once more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE END
